description.para: SEM DB for FL15A_PDDB_TRS_1503_009_00

The Account Manager class (AMGR) holds all necessary information to control the access by user login request tothe BTS. It contains the authorization matrix and all user accounts. It controls the order of account lookup in case that remote user information management is running in parallel to the BTS. It furthermore provides actions to read the own account information (except the password).
AMGR is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of AMGR is created at system startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
This parameter identifies the account manager. The value is always 1.

shortDesc.para: This parameter identifies the account manager. The value is always 1.

description.para: 25-10-2013 Pratima: The description has been modified. The IPv6 address format removed from the description.
This managed object represents a Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) Session.
At most 16 instances of BFD session can be created and deleted by the management system.
This parameter activates or deactivates the BFD session.
Activate: if set to value "true", the transmission of BFD control packets towards the remote peer is started and, in case the BFD session fails, alarms are raised.

Deactivate: if set to value "false", the transmission of BFD control packets towards the remote peer is stopped. Also the BTS discards every received BFD packet for a deactivated BFD instance. Moreover all active alarms related to the BFD session are cleared. The BFD session effectively does not exist at all.

shortDesc.para: This parameter activates or deactivates the BFD session.
Activate: if set to value true, the transmission of BFD control packets towards the remote peer is started and, in case the BFD session fails, alarms are raised.

Deactivate: if set to value false, the transmission of BFD control packets towards the remote peer is stopped. Also the BTS discards every received BFD packet for a deactivated BFD instance. Moreover all active alarms related to the BFD session are cleared.

p.name: bfdAdminUp
p.fullName: BFD session admin down state control

description.para: This parameter controls the admin state of the BFD session.
If set to "false", the session enters the "Down" state. Only control messages with state "Admin Down" are sent to the peer. All active alarms of the BFD session are cleared.
If set to "true", the session leaves the "Down" state. It will reach the "Up" state if the remote peer is also in "Up" state. If the BFD session fails, alarms are raised for it.

shortDesc.para: This parameter controls the admin state of the BFD session.
If set to false, the session enters the "Down" state. Only control messages with state "Admin Down" are sent to the peer. All active alarms of the BFD session are cleared.
If set to true, the session leaves the "Down" state. It will reach the "Up" state if the remote peer is also in "Up" state. If the BFD session fails, alarms are raised for it.

pRefDesc.para: Parameter bfdAdminUp is only relevant if parameter bfdActivation has value true.

p.name: bfdDetectMult
p.fullName: BFD session lost packets detection time multiplier

description.para: The negotiated BFD control word transmission interval, multiplied by this parameter, provides the detection time for lost packets in the BFD session. Roughly speaking bfdDetectMult is the number of BFD control packets that the FTM may lose in a row, before it shall declare the BFD session to be down.

shortDesc.para: The negotiated BFD control word transmission interval, multiplied by this parameter, provides the detection time for lost packets in the BFD session. Roughly speaking bfdDetectMult is the number of BFD control packets that the FTM may lose in a row, before it shall declare the BFD session to be down.

This parameter indicates on the BFD group to which the BFD session belongs.
The parameter is a managed object instance identifier (LMOID), referencing an instance of object class BFDGRP. The parameter may remain empty, meaning the BFD session is not bound to a BFD group.
Example:
FTM-1/IPNO-1/BFDGRP-#
where # can be from 1..8.

shortDesc.para: This parameter references the BFD group of which the BFD session is a member.
The parameter is a managed object instance identifier (LMOID), referencing an instance of object class BFDGRP. The parameter may remain empty, meaning the BFD session is not bound to a BFD group.
Example:
FTM-1/IPNO-1/BFDGRP-#
where # can be from 1..8.

description.para: This parameter specifies the UDP source port to be used in the BFD session.
Note: value range and default value depend on the BFD type.
- For Multi Hop BFD, the value range is 4784, 49152...65535 and the default value = 4784.
- For Single Hop BFD the value range is 3784, 49152...65535 and the default value = 3784.

description.para: 24.06.2014 Nittala:Added new parameter as per CR3442.
Allow additional control over legacy pairing protocol implementation.
If legacyPairingOPTMode = -2 (configured PIN mode), the initial bytes of the configured legacyPairingSecret (up to 16 bytes in all after hex unencoding) is used as a fixed legacy PIN;

Otherwise, counter-based logic adapted from RFC 6238/RFC4226 uses secret B1 derived from legacyPairingSecret as a key for generating a series of site-specific, one time 16 byte PINs based on RFC6238/RFC4226.
If legacyPairingOPTMode is set to -1 (rotating PIN mode), the applicable counter advances based on internal BTS logic.
If legacyPairingOPTMode is set between 0 and 214748264 (generated static PIN mode), the applicable counter is fixed to the specified legacyPairingOPTMode value.

shortDesc.para: Configure OTP mode for Bluetooth legacy pairing.

description.para: 16.01.2014 Nittala: Parameter added per LTE1702.
rotating PIN mode

Configures site-specific secrets associated with Bluetooth legacy pairing . The configured secret must be entered as a hex encoded string. For example, binary string 1mA is represented by hex encoding 316D41.

With Legacy Pairing OTP Mode = -2 (configured PIN mode), legacyPairingSecret can be used to explicitly configure a fixed legacy pairing PIN. For this case, the operator should carefully consider the limitations of any expected Bluetooth peers. A complex PIN is more secure. However, a PIN containing only digits is mostly widely compatible.

With Legacy Pairing OTP Mode >= -1 (rotating PIN mode or generated static PIN mode), legacyPairingSecret can be used to assign a custom legacy pairing secret B1 for the legacy OTP algorithm. If legacyPairingSecret is left empty in these modes, secret B1 is set to a default value known to all sites and all NSN customers.

shortDesc.para: Configures site-specific secrets associated with Bluetooth legacy pairing.

description.para: If legacyPairingOPTMode == -2 (configured PIN mode), legacyPairingSecret has to be a non-empty string
16.01.2014 Nittala: Parameter added per LTE1702
empty string
Allow user to timeout pairing relationship after the configured number of hours.

If it is set to 0: Immediately clear all pairing relationships and connections at time of configuration change; no subsequent pairing or connections allowed until Pairing Relationshio Timout changed to a non-zero value.
If it is set to 169 : Do not automatically timeout pairing relationships;
If it is set to the value between 1 and 168, the value is the timeout in hours. Once the age of a pairing relationship reaches the timeout, BTS will automatically timeout the pairing relationship.

If the device is connected at the time of pairing timeout, the device is not forcibly disconnected by the pairing timeout. However, subsequent connection after expired pairing relationship will require a fresh pairing.

shortDesc.para: Allow operator to timeout pairing relationships

description.para: Added per LTE1702 (FlexiZone Micro Bluetooth Support) on May 21, 2013. The feature is not in the pick list at the time when the parameter is entered.
3 hours
Allow operator to configure a persistent Bluetooth device whitelist and blacklist.

If the list contains at least one whitelisted device, only whitelisted devices may connect to or pair with the BTS. Otherwise, if the list contains blacklisted devices, the blacklisted devices can NOT connect to or pair with the BTS.

shortDesc.para: Persistent Bluetooth device whitelist/blacklist.

User shall enter a unique pairing order number for each Bluetooth device entry. Lower order numbers occur earlier in the structure.

description.para: 16.01.2014 Nittala: Parameter added per LTE1702

Configure site-specific secret for Bluetooth secure simple pairing. The configured secret must be entered as a hex encoded string. For example, binary string 1mA is represented by hex encoding 316D41.

If sspSecret is an empty string, a site-specific key, as derived from NSN's default algorithm, will be used as the key for counter-based generation of a series of one time 6 digit passkey per RFC6238/RFC4226;
If sspSecret is an non-empty string, Secure Simple Pairing Secret will be used as a key for counter-based generation of a series of one time 6 digit passkey per RFC6238/RFC4226.

shortDesc.para: Configure site-specific secret for Bluetooth secure simple pairing

The failure reason could be the following:
List (CRL) for one of the following reasons:
- The LDAP binding fails.
- The LDAP search is emtpy (no CRL found). / The LDAP search contains more
than one entry.
- The CRL signature validation fails.
- The CRL file exceeds the BTS storage limit.
- The BTS certificate is part of the CRL.
- DNS resolution for the CRL distribution point fails.

additionalInfo.para: Note : Complete URL is formed by appending http://<cmpServerIpAddress>:<cmpServerPort>/<cmpDirectory>/ by TRSW or BTSSM. User can enter the directory in any format, i.e. leading or trailing slash chars(examples of user entries “dir1/dir2”, “/dir1/dir2”, “dir1/dir2/”, “/dir1/dir2/”), and TRS/BTSSM sw takes care of building the full HTTP URL (removing duplicate and adding missing slash chars as needed).

description.para: This parameter holds the serial number of the certificate that must be removed.
In accordance with RFC 3280, serialNumber must allow to represent a positive integer of up to but no more than 20 octets.
The parameter value of serialNumber therefore is a octet ASCII hex string of at most 20 octets, where each octet contains a leading 0 if below 10H.

description.para: The Ethernet Link Interface (ETHLK) class represents a single physical Ethernet link interface of the BTS.

All instances of ETHLK are created at startup by the BTS. The number of instances depends on the type of the hardware unit that is installed onto the BTS. The instances of ETHLK cannot be deleted by the management system.
If the value of acceptableFrameTypes is "AdmitTagged", the device will discard untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface.

If the value is “AdmitAll”, tagged, untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface will be accepted. Untagged and Priority-tagged frames are assigned to the VLAN defined by the portDefaultVlanId for this interface.

shortDesc.para: If the value of acceptableFrameTypes is "AdmitTagged", the device will discard untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface.

If the value is “AdmitAll”, tagged, untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface will be accepted. Untagged and Priority-tagged frames are assigned to the VLAN defined by the portDefaultVlanId for this interface.

additionalInfo.para: Notes:
1) Priority tagged" frames (IEEE 802.1Q tagged frames with VLAN ID=0) can be configured via the VLAN filter list of parameter l2VlanIdList.

2) Ethernet management frames (i.e. Synchronous Ethernet and Ethernet OAM frames) are always allowed to ingress and egress the Ethernet interface of the layer 2 switch independent of the status of the value of the discardUntagged parameter.

description.para: 30-07-2012, lucy: Correct description for CN4420
2011.04.06: Vku: Renamed parameter and changed data type for CN4420

p.name: administrativeState
p.fullName: Administrative state of the ethernet link interface

description.para: This parameter is used to lock and unlock the ethernet link interface.
Locking the interface deactivates it.
Administrative state rules for correct configurations:
• Outdoor Module FSMx
1. ETHLK 0-1 at FSMx can be “unlocked” if Basic module FSMx present.
2. ETHLK 0-2 at FSMx can be “unlocked” if Basic module FSMx present and enable RP301Interface = false and if (TRS sub-module FTIF/FTLF present and ETHLK 1-1 = “locked” and ETHLK 1-3 = “locked”).
3. ETHLK 1-1 at FTIF/FTLF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FTIF/FTLF present and ETHLK 1-3 is “locked and ETHLK 0-2 = “locked””.
4. ETHLK 1-2 at FTIF/FTLF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FTIF/FTLF present and ETHLK 1-4 is “locked”.
5. ETHLK 1-3 at FTIF/FTLF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FTIF/FTLF present, ETHLK 1-1 is “locked” and ETHLK 0-2 = “locked”.
6. ETHLK 1-4 at FTIF/FTLF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FTIF/FTLF present and ETHLK 1-2 is “locked”.
• Indoor Module FSIx
1. ETHLK 0-1 at FSIx can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIx present and ETHLK 0-3 is “locked”.
2. ETHLK 0-2 at FSIx can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIx present and ETHLK 0-4 is “locked”.
3. ETHLK 0-3 at FSIx can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIx present and ETHLK 0-1 is “locked”.
4. ETHLK 0-4 at FSIx can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIx present and ETHLK 0-2 is “locked”.
5. ETHLK 0-5 at FSIx can be “unlocked” if Basic module FSIx present and enable RP301Interface = false and TRS sub-module FIIF present and ETHLK 1-1=”locked” and ETHLK 1-2=”locked.
6. ETHLK 1-1 at FIIF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FIIF present, ETHLK 1-2 is “locked” and enable RP301Interface = false and ETHLK 0-5= “locked”.
7. ETHLK 1-2 at FIIF can be “unlocked” if TRS sub-module FIIF present and ETHLK 1-1 is “locked” and enable RP301Interface = false and ETHLK 0-5= “locked”.

Note: If ETHLK 0-5 at FSIx is “unlocked” and TRS sub-module FIIF gets added, then … if enableRP301Interface is true then it is used as rp3 interface else ETHLK 0-2 is locked and external module ports are used
Module FSIH
1. ETHLK 0-1 at FSIH can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIH present and ETHLK 0-3 is “locked”.
2. ETHLK 0-2 at FSIH can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIH present and ETHLK 0-4 is “locked”.
3. ETHLK 0-3 at FSIH can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIH present and ETHLK 0-1 is “locked”.
4. ETHLK 0-4 at FSIH can be “unlocked” if Basic Module FSIH present and ETHLK 0-2 is “locked”.
5. ETHLK 0-5 at FSIH can be “unlocked” if Basic module FSIH present and enable RP301Interface = false
For Flexi Zone Micro, ETHLK-1-1 is the primary backhaul port in the default configuration.
ETHLK-1-1 is the primary backhaul port and is set by default to “unlocked”;
ETHLK-1-2 is the LMP and is set by default to “unlocked”.
ETHLK-1-3 is set by default to "locked" (applicable for FWHC, FWHE and FWHF only)
In case of FZM of type FWHC:
if "enableLayer2Switching" of MOC L2SWI is set to "false", administrativeState of the ETHLK MOC pointed by "ethLinkPoEPtr" of MOC "POE" must be set to "locked".
Note: Default value is removed since is "locked" for WMP and "unlocked" for FlexiZone Micro by default.

shortDesc.para: This parameter is used to lock and unlock the ethernet link interface.
Locking the interface deactivates it.

pRefDesc.para: In case of FZM of type FWHC:
if "enableLayer2Switching" of MOC L2SWI is set to "false", administrativeState of the ETHLK MOC pointed by "ethLinkPoEPtr" of MOC "POE" must be set to "locked"

description.para: 16.01.2014 Nittala: Parameter added per LTE1702.
26.05.2015 Nittala: Corrected Enum values (removed additional space) as per PR047246.
A missing or not installed SFP is reported the same as a unsupported SFP
This parameter identifies the BTS transport Ethernet interface.
Format: "slot#-if#"
where
slot# = slot number of the unit containing the Ethernet interfaces, and
if# = the interface number of the physical interface on the unit
and
for FTIB/FTLB,
slot#: 1 : This is always 1, since there is only 1 slot.
for FSMF/FSMG (Flexi BTS Release 3 Outdoor System Module),
slot#: 0 : This is always 0, since Transport is integrated into common system module.
if#: 1..2 : Value range is 1..2 for EIF1..EIF2 on this unit
Additionally, EIF2 can be configured as an RP3-01 port.
for FSIF/FSIG (Flexi BTS Release 3 Indoor System Module),
slot#: 0 : This is always 0, since Transport is integrated into common system module.
if#: 1..5 : Value range is 1..5 for EIF1..EIF5.
Usage of EIF1 and EIF3 is mutually exclusive. Similarly for EIF2 and EIF4. Additionally, EIF5 can be configured as an RP3-01 port.
for FTIF (optional outdoor external Transport module),
slot#: 1 : The slot number is '1', since this is an additional unit
if#: 1..4 : Value range is 1..4 for EIF1..EIF4 on this unit
Usage of EIF1 and EIF3 is mutually exclusive. Similarly for EIF2 and EIF4. Usage of EIF1/EIF3 on this unit and EIF2 on FSM is mutually exclusive.
for FIIF (optional indoor external Transport module),
slot#: 1 : The slot number is '1', since this is an additional unit
if#: 1..2 : Value range is 1..2 for EIF1..EIF2 on this unit
Usage of EIF1 and EIF2 is mutually exclusive on this unit. Usage of EIF1/EIF2 on this unit and EIF5 on FSI unit is mutually exclusive.
for FSMK,
slot#: 0 : This is always 0, since Transport is integrated into common system module.
if#: 1..4 : Value range is 1..4 for EIF1..EIF4.
Usage of EIF1 and EIF4 is mutually exclusive. Additionally, EIF2 can be configured as an RP3-01 port.
for FSIH,
slot#: 0 : This is always 0, since Transport is integrated into common system module.
if#: 1..5 : Value range is 1..5 for EIF1..EIF5.
Usage of EIF1 and EIF3 is mutually exclusive. Also EIF2 and EIF4 is mutually exclusive. Additionally, EIF5 can be configured as an RP3-01 port.
Examples:
FTIB/FTLB:
1-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 1. (EIF1)
FSMF/FSMG/FSIF/FSIG:
0-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 0. (EIF1)
FTIF/FIIF:
1-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 1. (EIF1)
For Flexizone micro, it is standalone device, box only has 1 slot.
1-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface EIF1 (port A);
1-2: refers to the physical Ethernet interface EIF2 (port B);
1-3: refers to the physical Ethernet interface EIF3 (port C) [Applicable only for FWHC, FWHE and FWHF]

shortDesc.para: This parameter identifies the BTS transport Ethernet interface.
Format: "slot#-if#"
where
slot# = slot number of the unit containing the Ethernet interfaces, and
if# = the interface number of the physical interface on the unit
Examples:
FTIB/FTLB:
1-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 1. (EIF1)
FSMF/FSMG/FSIF/FSIG:
0-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 0. (EIF1)
FTIF/FIIF:
1-1: refers to the physical Ethernet interface 1 in slot 1.(EIF1)

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666

This parameter specifies the maximum burst size that can be transmitted in a single burst in egress direction on this Ethernet interface of layer 2 switch. The burst size is actually calculated by < l2ShaperRate x l2BurstSize x 1sec >. Example: l2ShaperRate =100 Mb/s and l2BurstSize=1% results in a burst size of 1 Mbit = 125 Kbyte.
The step size is 0.1%. The maximum value is 6%. Default value is 0% (no bursts).
The parameter is only valid for the FTLB, and FSMr3, and FlexiZone Micro hardware unit types.
The default value is 0 which means no bursts are allowed.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the maximum burst size that can be transmitted in a single burst in egress direction on this Ethernet interface of layer 2 switch. The burst size is actually calculated by < l2ShaperRate x l2BurstSize x 1sec >. Example: l2ShaperRate =100 Mb/s and l2BurstSize=1% results in a burst size of 1 Mbit = 125 Kbyte.
The step size is 0.1%. The maximum value is 6%. Default value is 0% (no bursts).
The parameter is only valid for the FTLB, and FSMr3, and FlexiZone Micro HW unit types.

special.text: Value 0 means no bursts are allowed.

p.name: l2IngressRate
p.fullName: Layer 2 switch member ingress limiting rate

description.para: This parameter specifies the rate for limiting ingress traffic at the ethernet link interface. Parameter value unit = MBit/s.
The following granularities exist:
1 Mbps steps up to 10 Mpbs.
5 Mbps steps beyond 10 Mbps and up to 100 Mbps.
50 Mbps steps beyond 100 Mpbs and up to 1 Gbps.
Note: This parameter is not supported for FlexiZone Micro product, with the exception that in FWHC HW variant, this will be used for RateLimiting Ingress on the BH3 (PoE) port.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the rate for limiting ingress traffic at the ethernet link interface. Parameter value unit = MBit/s.
The following granularities exist:
1 Mbps steps up to 10 Mpbs.
5 Mbps steps beyond 10 Mbps and up to 100 Mbps.
50 Mbps steps beyond 100 Mpbs and up to 1 Gbps.
Note: This parameter is not supported for FlexiZone Micro product, with the exception that in FWHC HW variant, this will be used for RateLimiting Ingress on the BH3 (PoE) port.

description.para: 20100901, TNa: RT_35 added due to PR 66256ESPE04

By default the configured line rate of the interface is used. This is defined in parameter ETHLK - speedAndDuplex. If the line rate is not configured forcibly by the operator, it is autodetected by the BTS.

p.name: l2ShaperRate
p.fullName: Layer 2 switch member egress shaping rate

description.para: This parameter specifies egress the shaping rate of the Ethernet interface. Parameter value unit is in MBit/s.
The following granularities exist:
1 Mbps steps up to 10 Mbps.
5 Mbps steps beyond 10 Mbps and up to 100 Mbps.
50 Mbps steps beyond 100 Mbps and up to 1 Gbps.

NOTE:All Transport IF cards (FTIA,FTIB,FTFB,FTLB and FSMr3) shall support configuration of 1 Mbps at the switch-port shaper, but it is known, that FTLB effectively egresses 1.18 Mbps and FSMr3 egresses 1.56 Mbps, both of which are acceptable deviations.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies egress the shaping rate of the Ethernet interface. Parameter value unit is in MBit/s.
The following granularities exist:
1 Mbps steps up to 10 Mbps.
5 Mbps steps beyond 10 Mbps and up to 100 Mbps.
50 Mbps steps beyond 100 Mbps and up to 1 Gbps.

additionalInfo.para: NOTE:All Transport IF cards (FTIA,FTIB,FTFB,FTLB and FSMr3) shall support configuration of 1 Mbps at the switch-port shaper, but it is known, that FTLB effectively egresses 1.18 Mbps and FSMr3 egresses 1.56 Mbps, which both are acceptable deviations.

description.para: 20101013. vipul: changed the description
20100901, TNa: RT_35 added due to PR 66256ESPE04
18-04-2012, lucy: Description changed for PR29841ESPE07, PR54376ESPE03

By default the configured line rate of the interface is used. This is defined in parameter ETHLK - speedAndDuplex. If the line rate is not configured forcibly by the operator, it is autodetected by the BTS.

p.name: l2VlanIdList
p.fullName: Layer 2 switch member VLAN identifier list

description.para: This parameter specifies the VLANs that are supported over this ethernet interface. The parameter is a list of up to 16 entries where each entry represents either a single VLAN identifier or a range of VLAN identifiers. It is strongly recommended that VLAN identifiers of the various entries would not overlap each other. It is also recommended that PVID, defined by parameter portDefaultVlanId, would not appear in any of l2VlanIdList entry.

The default value of the parameter is single range entry and is defined with value 2-4094 for VLAN ID list in BTS Site Manager and by planning value 2 for lowValue and value 4094 for highValue in NetAct.
A maximum of 100 different VLANs are allowed for FTIB unit.
The default value is empty for FTIB unit and 2…4094 range for FTLB and rel3 units.
Note:The limitations shall be enforced when Service OAM (SOAM) is enabled.

shortDesc.para: It specifies the VLANs that are supported over this ethernet interface.It is a list of upto 16 entries where each entry represents either a single or a range of VLAN identifiers. It is strongly recommended that VLAN identifiers of the various entries would not overlap each other.It is also recommended that PVID,defined by parameter portDefaultVlanId, would not appear in any of l2VlanIdList entry.
The default value is single range entry and is defined by planning value 2 for lowValue and 4094 for highValue.

description.para: The limitations shall be enforced when Service OAM (SOAM) is enabled
19-09-2013 Pratima: The description for the parameter has been changed due to LBT1810.

08-01-2014 Nittala: The description has been enhanced due to PR 79925ESPE03.
08-01-2014 Nittala: The relationship to the parameter l2switchingMode has been removed as its a deleted parameter due to PR 104165ESPE01.
20.03.2014 Nittala:Modified description and related parameterse as per PR 114560ESPE04

description.para: 31-07-2012, lucy: Corrected description as per WBTS_TRS_10578
08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666
Enables the Link OAM functionality for this ethernet link. In consequence:
- the values of all statistics counters of the Link OAM feature for this interface are set to 0
- the Link OAM alarms for this interface are cleared
- the Link OAM discovery process is started, either in active or in passive mode.
For FlexiZone Micro:
This parameter shall be set to FALSE for ETHLK-1-3 in case of FWHC.

shortDesc.para: Enables the Link OAM functionality for this ethernet link. In consequence:
- the values of all statistics counters of the Link OAM feature for this interface are set to 0
- the Link OAM alarms for this interface are cleared
- the Link OAM discovery process is started, either in active or in passive mode.
The parameter supports FTLB,FTIB,FSM,FTIF HW.
For FlexiZone Micro:
This parameter shall be set to FALSE for ETHLK-1-3 in case of FWHC.

pRefDesc.para: The value of linkOAMEnabled shall only be set to true, if the value of linkOAMProfile is not the empty string but references an existing instance of object class OAMPRF.

A reference to a Link OAM profile. This is a distinguished name referencing an instance of class OAMPRF.
Format: "FTM-1/OAMPRF-*"
where
FTM-1: = a parent instance of object class ETHLK, This is always 1 (static MO)
OAMPRF-#, # = an instance of object class OAMPRF
Example: FTM-1/OAMPRF-1

where

Example: FTM-1/OAMPRF-1

This parameter shows the MAC address of the Ethernet link.

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows the MAC address of the Ethernet link.

description.para: 17112010, vipul : copied the parameter from SEM to SCF database

p.name: oamLinkReset
p.fullName: Action to restart the Link OAM function

description.para: This action restarts the Link OAM functionality for this interface.
- The BTS resets all OAM performance counters for this interface.
- The BTS clears all OAM alarms on this interface.
- The BTS starts or restarts the OAM discovery process either in active or passive mode as configured in the Link OAM profile of the interface.

shortDesc.para: This action restarts the Link OAM functionality for this interface.
- The BTS resets all OAM performance counters for this interface.
- The BTS clears all OAM alarms on this interface.
- The BTS starts or restarts the OAM discovery process either in active or passive mode as configured in the Link OAM profile of the interface.

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666
This parameter holds the result of Link OAM restart operation.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the result of Link OAM restart operation.

p.name: operationalState
p.fullName: Operational state of the ethernet link

description.para: This parameter holds the operational state of the ethernet link.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the operational state of the ethernet link.

description.para: This parameter shows the received optical power on the ethernet interface.
The parameter contains one of the following:
1) a floating point for unit dBm number rounded to one digit, e.g. "-4.1"
2) not supported -- the HW does not support this measurement
3) not connected -- the hot-pluggable transceiver is not in place
4) -INF -- the measured value is below the valid measurement range: log(0) yields the negative infinity.

shortDesc.para: This is the received optical power on the ethernet interface, i.e. one of the following:
1) a number in dBm, rounded to one digit, e.g. "-4.1"
2) not supported (measurement not supported)
3) not connected (HW not in place)
4) -INF (infinite)

description.para: Default VLAN priority for untagged frames.

Every untagged ingress Ethernet frame at this interface gets assigned this Port Default Priority. If QoS classification mode is configured to VLAN-PCP, this priority is used for enqueing decision of the frame. If the frame egresses the switch tagged, this priority shall be used in the VLAN tag header.

shortDesc.para: Default VLAN priority for untagged frames.

Every untagged ingress Ethernet frame at this interface gets assigned this Port Default Priority. If QoS classification mode is configured to VLAN-PCP, this priority is used for enqueing decision of the frame. If the frame egresses the switch tagged, this priority shall be used in the VLAN tag header.

description.para: 08-01-2014 Nittala: The relationship to the parameter l2switchingMode has been removed as its a deleted parameter due to PR 104165ESPE01.

p.name: portDefaultVlanId
p.fullName: Default VLAN identifier for layer 2 switching

description.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is inserted internally by the FTM into an untagged ingress frame that enters the layer 2 switch via this Ethernet interface.

In order that the frame will be transmitted via another Ethernet interface, after layer 2 switching has been performed, the same VLAN id must be configured in the VLAN identifier list of that Ethernet interface (see parameter l2VlanIdList). Else the frame will be discarded.
NOTE:Default VLAN id cannot be configured as a part of interface's configured VLAN id list.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is inserted internally by the FTM into an untagged ingress frame that enters the layer 2 switch via this Ethernet interface.

In order that the frame will be transmitted via another Ethernet interface, after layer 2 switching has been performed, the same VLAN id must be configured in the VLAN identifier list of that Ethernet interface. Else the frame will be discarded.

pRefDesc.para: Default VLAN id cannot be configured as a part of interface's configured VLAN id list
VLAN aware switching mode should be enabled (l2SwitchingMode="VLAN_ID")

p.name: rxFrames
p.fullName: Number of non OAMPDU frames received

description.para: The parameter holds the number of received non-OAMPDUs frames, which were looped back by the remote peer (for the Ethernet interface, where the Loopback mode was activated). It is a read-only parameter.

shortDesc.para: The parameter holds the number of received non-OAMPDUs frames, which were looped back by the remote peer (for the Ethernet interface, where the Loopback mode was activated). It is a read-only parameter.

description.para: 20113006,lucy: added new parameter for EM
This parameter specificies if the ethernet link characteristics are autonegotiated or not.
If not, the attribute contains the capacity and the duplex mode to be set forcibly. Note that 1000 MBit is available only on Gigabit Ethernet interfaces (GE).
Note: In case the shared RP3-01/TRS port (i.e. FCT-EIF2) is configured for transport, exclusively 1000 Mbps link speed is supported.
For Flexi zone micro:
Electrical GE interface supports AUTODETECT, 1000MBIT_FULL and 100MBIT_FULL.
Optical GE interface supports AUTODETECT, 1000MBIT_FULL, 10GBIT_FULL with the following exception:
FWQA: the optical 10 GE interface does not support AUTODETECT.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specificies if the ethernet link characteristics are autonegotiated or not.
If not, the attribute contains the capacity and the duplex mode to be set forcibly.
Note: In case the shared RP3-01/TRS port (i.e. FCT-EIF2) is configured for transport, exclusively 1000 Mbps link speed is supported.

additionalInfo.para: Note for FlexiZone Micro:
Electrical GE interface supports AUTODETECT, 1000MBIT_FULL and 100MBIT_FULL.
Optical GE interface supports AUTODETECT and 1000MBIT_FULL.
EIF1 is optical GE interface and EIF2 is electrical GE interface, except hardware unit type FWGH; FWGH is only unit type for which both EIF1 and EIF2 are electrical GE interfaces.
FWHE and FWHF units have EIF3 in addition to EIF1 and EIF2, EIF3 is optical GE interface.

pRefDesc.para: Note: Validation of the configured link-speed against the shaper rate configuration is not required and not reported to operator via any warning or alarm.
Note: Validation of the configured link-speed against the shaper rate configuration is not required and not reported to operator via any warning or alarm.

description.para: This parameter allows user to specify Ethernet link interface used for primary backhaul.
The default value is EIF1 (port A).
Note: For FWHC, EIF3 cannot be configured for this parameter.

shortDesc.para: This parameter allows user to specify Ethernet link interface used for primary backhaul.
The default value is EIF1 (port A).
Note: For FWHC, EIF3 cannot be configured for this parameter.

pRefDesc.para: administrativeState of ETHLK - Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port A (EIF1), if administrative state of ETHLK-1-1 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port B (EIF2) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-2 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port C (EIF3) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-3 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port D (EIF4) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-4 is on locked state.
primBackhaulPort can be set to 3 in the case only if HW type is FWHE, or FWHF. All other HW types, primBackhaulPort can only be set to EIF1 or EIF2.
primBackhaulPort, daisyChainPort and lmtPort cannot be set to the same port.

description.para: administrativeState of ETHLK - Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port A (EIF1), if administrative state of ETHLK-1-1 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port B (EIF2) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-2 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port C (EIF3) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-3 is on locked state.
Primary backhaul port cannot be set to port D (EIF4) if administrative state of ETHLK-1-4 is on locked state.
For FZMs with 3 ports (e.g. FWCB, FWHE, FWHF, FWHR, FWHT, etc.):
primBackhaulPort can be set to 1, 2, or 3.
For FZMs with 4 ports (e.g. FWQA, etc.):
primBackhaulPort can be set to 1, 2, 3 or 4.
For all other FZM hardware variant types:
primBackhaulPort can be set to 1 or 2.
primBackhaulPort, daisyChainPort, and lmtPort cannot be set to the same port;

p.name: localIpAddr
p.fullName: IP address of the plain Ethernet network interface

description.para: This is the IP address of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network. It has an associated subnet mask.
If the address is set to 0.0.0.0, the interface is taken out of use. Instead, VLAN interfaces are used (IVIF object instance).

shortDesc.para: This is the IP address of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network. It has an associated subnet mask.
If the address is set to 0.0.0.0, the interface is taken out of use. Instead, VLAN interfaces are used (IVIF object instance).

pRefDesc.para: When actIpv6 = TRUE and If M/S plane application are using this interface, then localIpAddr is mandatory

description.para: 25-04-2013, Pratima: Related parameters for IPv6 has been added. Related features with the description has been added for LTE125. Parameter made to be optional.

p.name: localIpv6Addr
p.fullName: Plain Ethernet Network Interface IPv6 Address

description.para: This is the IPv6 address of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network.
Format: parameter with IPv6 address acc. to RFC4291.
If the address is set to 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0 in full notation or :: abbreviated, the interface is taken out of use. Instead, VLAN interfaces are used (IVIF object instance).

shortDesc.para: This is the IPv6 address of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network.
Format: parameter with IPv6 address acc. to RFC4291.
If the address is set to 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0 in full notation or :: abbreviated, the interface is taken out of use.
Instead, VLAN interfaces are used (IVIF object instance).

additionalInfo.para: Note: When actIpv6 falge is true, changing of Interface IPV6 addresss shall not trigger BTS Restart

pRefDesc.para: When actIpv6 = TRUE and C/U V6 plane application are using this interface, then localIpv6Addr is mandatory.

description.para: If localIpAddr=0.0.0.0
localIpv6Addr must be also 0::0
The IPv4-mapped-IPv6 Address, as representation of an IPv4 address in an IPv6 address field, is not supported and shall be rejected.

p.name: localIpv6PrefixLength
p.fullName: Plain Ethernet Network Interface IPv6 Prefix-Length

description.para: This is the IPv6 prefix-length parameter of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network.
Format: parameter acc. to RFC4291.
The default value is 0.
Note: Values 1 and 2 are not allowed.

shortDesc.para: This is the IPv6 prefix-length parameter of the plain Ethernet network interface towards the external transport network.
Format: parameter acc. to RFC4291.
The default value is 0.
Note: Values 1 and 2 are not allowed.

additionalInfo.para: Note: When actIpv6 flag is true, changing of Interface IPV6 addresss shall not trigger BTS Restart

description.para: [05-03-2013 Pratima]: The name of the parameter has been changed with the change in data type and range.
[12-03-2013 Jerry]: Removed RAC Validation Pattern due to type change to number.

23-07-2014 Nittala: Enhanced description with a note as per PR118358ESPE04
04.06.2015 Nittala: Removed default value since this parameter is HW specific and updated description with the default value as per PR049552.
This is the maximum transfer unit of the Ethernet interface.

NOTE: For HW unit types FTIB/FTLB, the supported range is '576..1608 octets'. For HW unit types FSM/FTIF, the supported range is '576..1644 octets'. For all HW FlexiZone Micro unit types, the supported range is '576..1644 octets'.

shortDesc.para: This is the maximum transfer unit of the Ethernet interface.
NOTE: For HW unit types FTIB/FTLB, the supported range is '576..1608 octets'. For HW unit types FSM/FTIF, the supported range is '576..1644 octets'.
For all HW FlexiZone Micro unit types, the supported range is '576..1644 octets'.

additionalInfo.para: NOTE: For HW unit types FTIB/FTLB, the supported range is '576..1608 octets'. For HW unit types FSM/FTIF, the supported range is '576..1644 octets'.

description.para: If parameter uPlaneIpv6Address and/or cPlaneIpv6Address in MOC IPNO and/or parameter localIpv6Addr in MOC IVIF or IEIF is configured parameter mtu must be equal or greater than 1280

pRefDesc.para: When actIpv6 = TRUE and If M/S plane application are IEIF-localIpAddr interface, then netmask is mandatory.

description.para: [11-03-2013 Pratima]: Related Parameters has been removed for IPv6. The parameter becomes mandatory. Related Features for IPv6 has been removed.
25-04-2013, Pratima :Related Parameters has been added for IPv6. The parameter becomes optional. Related Features for IPv6 has been added.
This parameter specifies if multiple PHB queues are used over this interface or only a single one. Multiple PHB queues allow DSCP based traffic prioritization.
The plain Ethernet interface by default has the 6 PHB queue scheduler.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies if multiple PHB queues are used over this interface or only a single one. Multiple PHB queues allow DSCP based traffic prioritization.
The plain Ethernet interface by default has the 6 PHB queue scheduler.

feature.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

featureComponent.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

description.para: The plain IP interface by default has the 6 PHB queue scheduler.
This parameter holds the shaper burst size for the interface.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the shaper burst size for the interface.

description.para: 24-09-2012, lucy: PR112694ESPE02 change minimum range to 4000 and default value
PR80361ESPE04 changes in Range and default value:Lucy
The Total Shaper Burst Size ("SBS") defines the maximum burst size that is allowed to pass at the output of the WFQ aggregator.

shortDesc.para: The Total Shaper Burst Size ("SBS") defines the maximum burst size that is allowed to pass at the output of the WFQ aggregator.

description.para: This parameter holds the shaper information rate for the interface.
For FTLB, the actual minimum egress rate is 1.18 Mbps and on FSM-r3, the actual minimum egress rate is 1.56 Mbps due to technical limitations on Octeon.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the shaper information rate for the interface.
For FTLB, the actual minimum egress rate is 1.18 Mbps and on FSM-r3, the actual minimum egress rate is 1.56 Mbps due to technical limitations on Octeon.

pRefDesc.para: Validation of the configured shaper rate against the link-speed configuration is not required and not reported to operator via any warning or alarm.

description.para: Validation of the configured shaper rate against the link-speed configuration is not required and not reported to operator via any warning or alarm.
11-04-2014 Nittala: Added related parameter due to PR 113728ESPE04.
This parameter holds the total Shaper Information Rate ("SIR") at the output of the WFQ aggregator.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the total Shaper Information Rate ("SIR") at the output of the WFQ aggregator.

description.para: Parameter sirTotal is only relevant in case parameter trafficPathShapingEnable has value TPS_WFQ.

This parameter decides on the type of shaping in case of VLANs. When traffic path shaping is enabled, shaping at the level of each VLAN is enabled, else shaping at the WFQ aggregator level is enabled. Shaping may also be switched off entirely.

shortDesc.para: This parameter decides on the type of shaping in case of VLANs. When traffic path shaping is enabled, shaping at the level of each VLAN is enabled, else shaping at the WFQ aggregator level is enabled. Shaping may also be switched off entirely.

description.para: 19-09-2013 Pratima: The default value and default note has been changed accordingly due to LBT1810.
By default, shaping is disabled.

p.name: upperLayerShaping
p.fullName: Take ethernet overhead into account when shaping

description.para: This parameter decides if shaping takes the ethernet overhead into account. If the flag has value "true", the shaped bandwidth is the bandwidth on the IP layer only. If the flag has value "false", the ethernet header is counted also.

shortDesc.para: This parameter decides if shaping takes the ethernet overhead into account. If the flag has value" true", the shaped bandwidth is the bandwidth on the IP layer only. If the flag has value "false", the ethernet header is counted also.

description.para: vipul, added default value.
By default the ethernet shaping should be disabled.
This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for this interface.

shortDesc.para: This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for this interface.

description.para: IHCP is used for IP address configuration of BTS external devices.

p.name: client_identifier
p.fullName: Entry set for DHCP clients identified by a system name

description.para: This is the set of entries in the DHCP database of the BTS that is used to bind an IP address to a DHCP client that identifies itself at the BTS by a system name (by a "text string").

shortDesc.para: This is the set of entries in the DHCP database of the BTS that is used to bind an IP address to a DHCP client that identifies itself at the BTS by a system name (by a "text string").

feature.name: LTE684 DHCP Server for Flexi LTE BTS Site Devices

featureComponent.name: LTE684 DHCP Server for Flexi LTE BTS Site Devices

description.para: This is a unique string used in the DHCP server of the BTS for identifying a DHCP client that is assigned a fixed IP address.
This may either be one of the predefined names "RET1" (Remote Electrical Tilt), "RET2", "BBU" and "LMU" or a user-defined name consisting of up to 20 digits [0-9] or letters [a-z] and [A-Z].

shortDesc.para: This is a unique string used in the DHCP server of the BTS for identifying a DHCP client that is assigned a fixed IP address.
This may either be one of the predefined names "RET1" (Remote Electrical Tilt), "RET2", "BBU" and "LMU" or a user-defined name consisting of up to 20 digits [0-9] or letters [a-z] and [A-Z].

feature.name: LTE684 DHCP Server for Flexi LTE BTS Site Devices

featureComponent.name: LTE684 DHCP Server for Flexi LTE BTS Site Devices

description.para: 11-07-2013 Pratima: Parameter made to be mandatory.
This parameter specifies the fixed IP address that is to be assigned to the DHCP client if it requests a lease with the name specified in parameter dhcpClientIdentifier.
The IP address must be within the public IP subnet of the BTS. However, neither the IP addresses of the BTS nor its subnet IP address must be used.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the fixed IP address that is to be assigned to the DHCP client if it requests a lease with the name specified in parameter dhcpClientIdentifier.
The IP address must be within the public IP subnet of the BTS. However, neither the IP addresses of the BTS nor its subnet IP address must be used.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.

The IKE Security Association object holds the list of IKE associations of the FTM. This object is a singleton. The object is fully controlled by the managed system. It is created by the managed system. It cannot be modified by the management system. It cannot not be deleted by the management system.

p.name: operationalState
p.fullName: Summarized operational state of the IKE associations

description.para: This parameter holds the operational state of the IKE associations object. The operational state summarizes the operational states of the individual IKE associations. As long as one of the individual IKE associations is disabled, the operational state of the object is disabled. Only if all associations are enabled, the overall operational state is enabled.

description.para: The NTP Server Configuration (INTP) class represents the NTP server functionality of the BTS.
INTP is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of INTP is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

<year 4 digits>-<month 2 digits>-<days 2 digits>T<hours 2 digits>:<minutes 2 digits>:<seconds 2 digits>

p.name: ntpServers
p.fullName: List of NTP server IP addresses

description.para: This parameter specifies the IP addresses of the NTP servers. To be entered in the dotted decimal format.

Note: The NTP server configuration is mandatory in fsmr2 since this is the only time source for FTM but although its optional in fsmr3 due to GPS time availability, it’s always treated as mandatory and used as a backup if GPS time is lost.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the IP addresses of the NTP servers. To be entered in the dotted decimal format.

Note: The NTP server configuration is mandatory in fsmr2 since this is the only time source for FTM but although its optional in fsmr3 due to GPS time availability, it’s always treated as mandatory and used as a backup if GPS time is lost.

description.para: The IP Node Configuration class (IPNO) represents the IP functionality of the BTS. It contains all global IP-related parameters of the BTS.
IPNO is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of IP Node Configuration is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

The default value is "false".

p.name: actIpv6
p.fullName: Feature Activation Flag IPv6 For U/C-Plane

description.para: This parameter enables/disables the optional feature "IPv6 for U/C-plane" (LTE125)
The default value is "false".

shortDesc.para: This parameter enables/disables the optional feature "IPv6 for U/C-plane" (LTE125)
The default value is "false".

pRefDesc.para: If actIpv6=False parameters cplaneIpAddress must be configured.
If actIpv6=False parameters uPlaneIpAddress must be configured.
If actIpv6=True parameters uPlaneIpv6Address must be configured
If actIpv6=True parameters cPlaneIpv6Address must be configured

description.para: If actIpv6 = TRUE then MCAPP MO cannot be created nor is allowed to exist. And if MCAPP exists then actIpv6 cannot be set to value TRUE.

p.name: actSeparationRanSharing
p.fullName: Activation Flag Transport Separation For RAN Sharing

description.para: This parameter activates/deactivates the feature "Transport Separation for RAN Sharing"
If IPsec is enabled and additional transport network is deleted or modified, then actSeparationRanSharing should be disabled first.
The default value is "false".

shortDesc.para: This parameter activates/deactivates the feature "Transport Separation for RAN Sharing"
If IPsec is enabled and additional transport network is deleted or modified, then actSeparationRanSharing should be disabled first.
The default value is "false".

pRefDesc.para: In case actSeparationRanSharing=TRUE parameter "maintransportNwId" in MOC "IPNO" must be configured
In case actSeparationRanSharing=TRUE "transportNwId" in MOC "LTAC" must be configured
If actDualUPlaneAddress is set to 'true' then actSeparationRanSharing shall be set to 'false'
If actSeparationRanSharing = TRUE then MCAPP MO cannot be created nor is allowed to exist. And if MCAPP exists then actSeparationRanSharing cannot be set to value TRUE.

description.para: If actSeparationRanSharing is set to 'true', then
- MCAPP - usedLinkLayerIf shall not be configured
- actDualUPlaneIpAddress shall be set to 'false'.

description.para: 12-07-2013, Pratima: Added new parameter for PR125373ESPE02.

This parameter specifies the IP address to be used for control plane traffic. The IP address may collapse with a network interface IP address. If it does not collapse with a network interface IP address, it is considered to be virtual.
The control plane IP address may also collapse with the uPlaneIpAddress, the mPlaneIpAddress and the sPlaneIpAddress.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the IP address to be used for control plane traffic. The IP address may collapse with a network interface IP address. If it does not collapse with a network interface IP address, it is considered to be virtual.
The control plane IP address may also collapse with the uPlaneIpAddress, the mPlaneIpAddress and the sPlaneIpAddress.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.

additionalInfo.para: Note: If actIpv6=TRUE change of Ipv4 C-plane address shall not cause a BTS restart.

pRefDesc.para: When actIpv6 = FALSE then cPlaneIpAddress is mandatory parameter else cPlaneIpAddress is optional parameter

p.name: oamIpAddr
p.fullName: Transport network IP address of the O&M system

description.para: This parameter holds the transport network IP address of the O&M system for the FTM. To be entered in dotted decimal format.
If only 1 OMS IP is configured, then BTS executes an autonomous site reset after change of that IP address so that BTS will take into use the new values.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the transport network IP address of the O&M system for the FTM. To be entered in dotted decimal format.
If only 1 OMS IP is configured, then BTS executes an autonomous site reset after change of that IP address so that BTS will take into use the new values.

pRefDesc.para: If more than 1 IP is configured, then to change the IP address of the current serving OMS (primary/secondary),
1. Execute an OMS switchover
2. Change the OMS IP that is not the current serving OMS
3. Execute another OMS switchover.
When only 1 configured IP (primary/secondary), changing the current serving OMS IP Address requires a BTS restart. BTS executes autonomous site reset.

description.para: 2011.03.10: JTh: Modified for LTE475 PRs 83741ESPE02/83736ESPE02.
If this parameter is set to "true", the optional TLV received in a Link Trace or Loopback message (LTM or LBM message) is sent back unchecked in the corresponding reply message (LTR, or LBR).
If this parameter is set to "false", the received optional TLV is ignored and not being sent in the reply-message.
NOTE: By default, the parameter is set to 'false'

shortDesc.para: If this parameter is set to "true", the optional TLV received in a Link Trace or Loopback message (LTM or LBM message) is sent back unchecked in the corresponding reply message (LTR, or LBR).
If this parameter is set to" false", the received optional TLV is ignored and not being sent in the reply-message.
NOTE: By default, the parameter is set to 'false'

description.para: 2011-05-17: JTh: New PSD "PAR MigrateSpecialForSwUpgrade" to resolve PR 86394ESPE02

This parameter specifies the administrator preference for how the NE should select its serving OMS. Automatic selection (value "automatic") means that the NE autonomously selects its serving OMS based on availability of the configured primary or secondary OMS. The NE may also be administratively assigned/locked to either the configured primary or the configured secondary OMS (values "primaryForced" and "secondaryForced").

shortDesc.para: Administrator setting for serving OMS.

pRefDesc.para: To be able to switch to the secondary OMS, either autonomously or via administrative switch-over, or to administratively assign/lock to the secondary OMS, the secondary OMS IP address must have a valid value.

When the serving OMS administrative setting is "primaryForced" or "secondaryForced", and the current serving OMS is different from that in the serving OMS administrative setting, a switch-over is implicit and a separate switch-over request is not needed.

description.para: 2010.03.17: JTh: Modified for LTE475 PRs 83741ESPE02/83736ESPE02.
NE selects serving OMS autonomously.
This parameter requests an administrative switch-over from current serving OMS (primary or secondary) to the other OMS. The parameter value specifies the OMS to which the switch-over is requested.

shortDesc.para: Request for switchover of serving OMS.

pRefDesc.para: If the configured secondary OMS IP address is unreachable, recovery via automatic OMS switch-over is possible only if servingOmsAdminSetting is "automatic".

To be able to switch to the secondary OMS, either autonomously or via administrative switch-over, or to administratively assign/lock to the secondary OMS, the secondary OMS IP address must have a valid value.

description.para: 2010.03.17: JTh: OMS probing removed along with modifications for LTE475 PRs 83741ESPE02/83736ESPE02.
By default no switchover is requested.

This parameter specifies the source port that is assigned to the TWAMP reflector. The sender on any measurement request packet shall use that port to reach the TWAMP reflector.
Note: UDP ports 7 (standard UDP echo port) and port range 5001..5010 (UDP ports of TWAMP sender) shall not be used for UDP reflector port.

Note: When configuring TWAMP reflector service, it is important to configure a UDP port that is not in use by any other service (such as 500 for IKE/IPsec for example). Otherwise both TWAMP and the conflicting service will be impacted and not work as expected. As many of the ports 1..1023 are typically in use for various services, it is recommended to select a port starting from 1024 (in most of the cases the default setting should be appropriate).
Note:For Flexizone micro, TWAMP reflector port number is always on 5018.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the source port that is assigned to the TWAMP reflector. The sender on any measurement request packet shall use that port to reach the TWAMP reflector. NOTE: By default, the parameter is assigned to the port 5000
Note: UDP ports 7 (standard UDP echo port) and port range 5001..5010 (UDP ports of TWAMP sender) shall not be used for UDP reflector port.
Note:For Flexizone micro, TWAMP reflector port number is always on 5018.

additionalInfo.para: Note: UDP ports 7 (standard UDP echo port) and port range 5001..5010 (UDP ports of TWAMP sender) shall not be used for UDP reflector port.

Note: When configuring TWAMP reflector service, it is important to configure a UDP port that is not in use by any other service (such as 500 for IKE/IPsec for example). Otherwise both TWAMP and the conflicting service will be impacted and not work as expected. As many of the ports 1..1023 are typically in use for various services, it is recommended to select a port starting from 1024 (in most of the cases the default setting should be appropriate).

p.name: wfqSchedOamWeight
p.fullName: WFQ aggregator queue weight for Service OAM messages

description.para: This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for Service OAM messages.
NOTE: By default, the parameter holds weight value 10

shortDesc.para: This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for Service OAM messages.

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666
2010-09-08: Vipul: modified the default value to 10
16-04-2013 Pratima: Default value field is updated with value 10.
In WCDMA, we have a default value of 1 Mbps for Service OAM CIR. If you derive the scheduler weight from CIR as recommended, you get 10. So using 10 means alignment between LTE & WCDMA.
This class hold IP-address- and port based rules for IP filtering.

p.name: RmExceptions
p.fullName: Restricted Mode exception list (IP address list)

description.para: The IPRM object provides filtering services for IP packets from and to the attached site support equipment. In this concept, by default the site support equipment cannot be accessed. IPRM defines up to 32 exceptions to this rule. Each exception is defined as a destination IP address to/from which traffic is allowed. Ports or protocol types are not taken into account.
NOTE: Exception can overlap but they cannot have exactly the same configuration

shortDesc.para: The IPRM object provides filtering services for IP packets from and to the attached site support equipment. In this concept, by default the site support equipment cannot be accessed. IPRM defines up to 32 exceptions to this rule. Each exception is defined as a destination IP address to/from which traffic is allowed. Ports or protocol types are not taken into account.
NOTE: Exception can overlap but they cannot have exactly the same configuration

If sourceTwoDisc has value SINGLE, this parameter specifies the only IP address from / towards which traffic is allowed.

NOTE: IP address 0.0.0.0 is not allowed

The IP Routing Table (IPRT) class holds the static and the dynamic routing tables of the BTS.
IPRT is a singeleton. Exactly 1 instance of IPRT is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

This is a set of entries, each defining a IP route. The set contains all IP routes there were "learned" by the BTS (via ARP, etc.). It also contains all static routes that are currently in use by the BTS.

shortDesc.para: This is a set of entries, each defining a IP route. The set contains all IP routes there were "learned" by the BTS (via ARP, etc.). It also contains all static routes that are currently in use by the BTS.

description.para: This parameter shows the IP address for indirectly connected (point-to-point) IP nodes (remote network) or the destination IP address of a route.
Format: this is either an IPv4 IP address in dotted decimal form or an IPv6 IP address in one of the formats defined in RFC 2373.
Examples:

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows the IP address for indirectly connected (point-to-point) IP nodes (remote network) or the destination IP address of a route.
Format: either dotted decimal form (IPv4) or one of the formats defined in RFC 2373 (IPv6).

description.para: This parameter shows the IP address of the next IP hop via which a remote network can be reached. This is available only in indirect routes. If the route is direct then instead of the gateway IP address the DCN Interface is displayed.
Format: this is either an IPv4 IP address in dotted decimal form or an IPv6 IP address in one of the formats defined in RFC 2373.
Examples:

shortDesc.para: This is the IP address of the next IP hop via which a remote network can be reached. This is available only for indirect routes (replaced by the DCN interface for direct routes).
Format: either dotted decimal (IPv4) or an RFC 2373 format (IPv6).

description.para: This parameter references the ethernet based IP interface or the vlan interface for this route. It is used for static direct routes only.
The value is a fully distinguished object instance identifier.
Example:
FTM-1/IPNO-1/IEIF-1
Note that in this release vlan interfaces are not supported.

shortDesc.para: This parameter references the ethernet based IP interface or the vlan interface for this route. It is used for static direct routes only.

Note that in this release vlan interfaces are not supported.

This object holds the configurable parameters for IPsec, i.e. the list of security policies and optionally the pre shared keys to be used over IPsec connections. This object is a singleton, created at startup by the managed system. It cannot be deleted by the management system.
This parameter enables or disables feature IPSec Backup Tunnel feature

shortDesc.para: This parameter enables or disables feature IPSec Backup Tunnel feature

pRefDesc.para: actIpSecBkupTun can be set TRUE, even if ipSecEnabled is set to FALSE, but IPsec backup tunnel feature is active only after both actIpSecBkupTun and ipSecEnabled are TRUE.

description.para: actIpSecBkupTun can be set TRUE, even if ipSecEnabled is set to FALSE, but IPsec backup tunnel feature is active only after both actIpSecBkupTun and ipSecEnabled are TRUE.
25-03-2014 Nittala:New parameter added due to feature LTE1753 IPsec backup tunnel.
The default value is false.

This structure allows user to manually switch (switchover or switchback) set of IPsec tunnels, which have a backup tunnel remote endpoint and a MANUAL switchback mode defined. Only tunnels that can be manually switched are included in this list and tunnels are identified with the local and remote tunnel endpoints of the primary tunnel.

shortDesc.para: This structure allows user to manually switch (switchover or switchback) set of IPsec tunnels, which have a backup tunnel remote endpoint and a MANUAL switchback mode defined. Only tunnels that can be manually switched are included in this list and tunnels are identified with the local and remote tunnel endpoints of the primary tunnel.

additionalInfo.para: This is IPsec Tunnel structure initially containing tunnel endpoints associated with IPsec protect policies. The parameter will contain only a set of tunnels selected by operator for manual switch.
When the parameter is received by BTS:
- switchover will happen for those tunnels included into this structure, which have primary tunnel active and which have MANUAL switchback mode defined.
- switchback will happen for those tunnels included in this structure, which have backup tunnel active and which have MANUAL switchback mode defined.
For e.g.
<localTEP>10.1.1.1</localTEP>
<remoteTEP>10.1.1.2</remoteTEP>
<localTEP>10.1.1.3</localTEP>
<remoteTEP>10.1.1.4</remoteTEP>

description.para: 1. The manual switch parameter should only be generated if ipSecEnabled is TRUE and actIpSecBkupTun is TRUE
2.ipSecTunnels parameter should NOT be sent along with ipSecBkupTunManSwitch in the same configuration
3. IPsec tunnel associated policy type is PROTECT
4. The order of parameters in commissioning file shall be as follows:
- Policy information
- Switchback mode(ipSecTunnels)
- Manual switchback request(ipSecBkupTunManSwitch)
25.03.2014 Nittala: Added new parameter as per LTE1753

Examples:

shortDesc.para: This parameter is the local tunnel endpoint IPAddress of the ipsec Tunnel(IKESA) whose related policies have secondary remote tunnel endpoint set to a valid non-default IPAddress and ipsec backup tunnel feature is enabled
Format: this is an IPv4 IP address in dotted decimal form.
Examples:

additionalInfo.para: This parameter is the local tunnel endpoint IPAddress of the ipsec Tunnel(IKESA) whose related policies have secondary remote tunnel endpoint set to a valid non-default IPAddress and ipsec backup tunnel feature is enabled.

description.para: This parameter is only applicable
1. if ipSecBkupTunRemoteEndpoint is set to a valid non-default remote tunnel IPAddress
2. BTS should ignore switch for each tunnel associated with remote tunnel endpoint that has ipSecBkupTunState set to Secondary_Active_Probing_Primary(2)
25.03.2014 Nittala: Added new parameter as per LTE1753

Format: this is an IPv4 IP address in dotted decimal form.

description.para: This parameter is only applicable
1. if ipSecBkupTunRemoteEndpoint is set to a valid non-default remote tunnel IPAddress

description.para: 11.04.2014 Nittala: Added related parameters as per LTE1753

This structure allows user to read and modify switchback mode of each tunnel that has backup remote tunnel endpoint defined. Tunnels are identified with primary local and remote tunnel endpoint addresses.

shortDesc.para: This structure allows user to read and modify switchback mode of each tunnel that has backup remote tunnel endpoint defined. Tunnels are identified with primary local and remote tunnel endpoint addresses.

additionalInfo.para: This is IPsec Tunnel structure initially containing tunnel endpoints associated with IPsec protect policies and corresponding switchback mode acquired from BTS. With this parameter operator is able to set switchback mode of tunnels that have IPsec Backup Tunnel remote endpoint defined.
For e.g.
<localTEP>10.1.1.1</localTEP>
<remoteTEP>10.1.1.2</remoteTEP>
<ipSecBkupTunSwitchbackMode>MANUAL</ipSecBkupTunSwitchbackMode>

description.para: 1. ipSecBkupTunManSwitch parameter should NOT be sent along with ipSecTunnels in the same configuration
2. IPsec tunnel associated policy type is PROTECT
3. The order of parameters in commissiong file shall be as follows:
- Policy information
- Switchback mode(ipSecTunnels)
- Manual switchback request(ipSecBkupTunManSwitch)

additionalInfo.para: This parameter indicates whether BTS should automatically or manually (operator command) switchback to primary ipsec Tunnel. In the case of automatic mode BTS will switchback to primary tunnel when available, while in manual mode, switchback will only be done upon operator request.
Note: All child SA’s using the same IKE SA should be configured with the same switchback mode

description.para: This parameter specifies the delay between the sending of two consecutive DPS INFORMATIONAL messages by the BTS. The INFORMATIONAL message indicates the BTS is still alive.
For IKEv2, the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm if the remote peer has not sent any INFORMATIONAL message to the BTS after the BTS has sent a fixed number of INFORMATIONAL messages.
For IKEv1 the BTS raises the DPD alarm, if the remote peer has not sent back any INFORMATIONAL messages after the time defined in the parameter dpdtimeout has expired.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the delay between the sending of two consecutive DPS INFORMATIONAL messages by the BTS. The message indicates the BTS is still alive.
For IKEv2, the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm if the remote peer has not sent any INFORMATIONAL message to the BTS after this BTS has sent a fixed number of INFORMATIONAL messages.
For IKEv1, the BTS raises the DPD alarm if the remote peer has not sent back any INFORMATIONAL messages after the time dpdtimeout has expired.

feature.name: LTE689 LTE IPsec Support for control and user plane

featureComponent.name: LTE689 LTE IPsec Support for control and user plane

description.para: This parameter specifies the time after which the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm.
The parameter dpddelay specifies the delay between the sending of two consecutive DPS INFORMATIONAL messages by the BTS. The INFORMATIONAL message indicates that the BTS is still alive.
For IKEv1, the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm if the remote peer has not sent back any INFORMATIONAL messages after the time defined in the parameter dpdtimeout has expired.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the time after which the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm.
The parameter dpddelay specifies the delay between the sending of two consecutive DPS INFORMATIONAL messages by the BTS. The INFORMATIONAL message indicates that the BTS is still alive.
For IKEv1, the BTS raises the Dead Peer Detected (DPD) alarm if the remote peer has not sent back any INFORMATIONAL messages after the time defined in the parameter dpdtimeout has expired.

description.para: This parameter holds the ESP encryption algorithm to be applied to the traffic data packet for which the policy matches.
The default value for ESP encryption algorithm offers 2 values (priority list) where
- AES-128 CBC is tried first (1. priority) and
- 3DES-192 CBC is tried next (2.priority).

additionalInfo.para: This parameter specifies the remote SEG endpoint IPAddress of the Secondary ipsec tunnel. It also enables backup tunnel feature for the primary tunnel associated with this policy.
This endpoint IPAddress will be used for creating backup ipsec Tunnel during switchover. The following rules apply
a. The backup tunnel remote endpoint IPAddress should be reachable from BTS
b. All child SA’s using the same IKE SA should be configured with the same ipsec backup tunnel remote endpoint address.
c. The ipsec backup tunnel remote endpoint address should not be the same for two different tunnels

This flag rules the basic treatment of a traffic data packet that applies to the selection criteria of this policy.
The values have the following meaning:
"DISCARD": the packet is discarded without any further action or notification, i.e. it is prevented from passing to its designated destination.
"BYPASS": the packet is delivered to its destination without any other processing, in particular without any further IPsec-related processing.
"PROTECT": the packet will be made subject to the settings of its security policy.

shortDesc.para: This flag rules the basic treatment of a traffic data packet that applies to the selection criteria of this policy.

additionalInfo.para: The values have the following meaning:
"DISCARD": the packet is discarded without any further action or notification, i.e. it is prevented from passing to its designated destination.
"BYPASS": the packet is delivered to its destination without any other processing, in particular without any further IPsec-related processing.
"PROTECT": the packet is made subject to the settings of its security policy.

feature.name: LTE689 LTE IPsec Support for control and user plane

featureComponent.name: LTE689 LTE IPsec Support for control and user plane

description.para: This parameter holds the local IP address of the data traffic packet for this policy as seen by the FTM.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.
The following combinations of local and remote IP addresses, local and remote port numbers and protocol are feasible:
- a single IP address (equivalent to netmask /32 in IPv4), no particular protocol/port
- a single IP address, selected protocol/port
- an IP subnet, no particular protocol/port
- an IP subnet, selected protocol/port.
Parameter value 0.0.0.0 means "wildcard" - all IP addresses are allowed.
Both IP address formats can be used.
Format: IPv4 address parameter in dotted decimals or IPv6 address parameter acc. to RFC 4291.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the local IP address of the data traffic packet for this policy as seen by the FTM.

Format: IPv4 address parameter in dotted decimals or IPv6 address parameter acc. to RFC 4291.

- IP subnet, selected protocol/port.

description.para: This parameter holds the maximum lifetime of an IPSEC security association. The IPSEC SA will be rekeyed at a random time between 270 and 180 seconds before the maximum lifetime expires, i.e. between (saMaxLifetime – 270 seconds) and (saMaxLifetime – 180 seconds) after establishing the IPSEC SA.
Note:

IKE SAs with a fixed maximum lifetime of 86400 seconds (24 hours) will be rekeyed at a random time between 3870 and 180 seconds before the maximum lifetime expires, i.e. between 82530 and 86220 seconds after establishing the IKE SA

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the maximum lifetime of an IPSEC security association. The IPSEC SA will be rekeyed at a random time between 270 and 180 seconds before the maximum lifetime expires, i.e. between (saMaxLifetime – 270 seconds) and (saMaxLifetime – 180 seconds) after establishing the IPSEC SA.

additionalInfo.para: Note:

IKE SAs with a fixed maximum lifetime of 86400 seconds (24 hours) will be rekeyed at a random time between 3870 and 180 seconds before the maximum lifetime expires, i.e. between 82530 and 86220 seconds after establishing the IKE SA

This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier number of the VLAN network interface.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier number of the VLAN network interface.

description.para: This parameter identifies the VLAN interface object. Value is 1 to 9. Up to 9 VLANs can exist on the BTS.
BTS supports VLAN interfaces with one PHB queue or 6 PHB queues.
Note: FZM supports only two 6 PHB queues.
The maximum number of VLAN interfaces supported are as below:
FSMr2=6, FSMr3=9, FZM=8.

This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for this VLAN interface.

shortDesc.para: This is the weight value to be used in the WFQ aggregation scheduler for this VLAN interface.

description.para: This class models the layer 2 switch used for QOS aware switching at the ethernet interface level.
Exactly 1 instance of Layer 2 Switch is created at startup by the managed system. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
This parameter maps DSCP values to packet scheduling queues. The table contains at most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value (0..63).
Default values for FTIB hardware unit type:
DSCP values 48,46 and 56 map to priority queue 1, this is the strict priority queue.
DSCP values 38, 36, 34, 30, 28 and 26 map to priority queue 2, this is the first WRR priority queue.
DSCP values 22, 20, 18, 14, 12 and 10 map to priority queue 3, this is the second WRR priority queue.
All other DSCP values map by default to priority queue 4, this is the third WRR priority queue.
Default values for FTLB, FSMr3 and FlexiZone Micro hardware unit types:
DSCP values 48,46 and 56 map to priority queue 1, this is the strict priority queue.
DSCP values 38, 36 and 34 map to priority queue 2, this is the first WRR priority queue.
DSCP values 30, 28 and 26 map to priority queue 3, this is the second WRR priority queue.
DSCP values 22, 20, 18, 14, 12 and 10 map to priority queue 4, this is the third WRR priority queue.
All other DSCP values map by default to priority queue 6, this is the fifth WRR priority queue.
For FlexiZone Micro the DSCP values 14, 12 and 10 map to priority queue 5, this is the fourth WRR priority queue.

shortDesc.para: This parameter maps DSCP values to priority queues. The table contains at most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value (0..63).

description.para: 01-10-2013 Pratima: The DSCP value 56 for queue 1 as default value has been added for PR 108990ESPE04
This parameter specifies a DSCP value.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies a DSCP value.

description.para: This parameter specifies a packet scheduling queue.
FTIB hardware unit type:
Packet scheduling queue values range from 1 to 4 where 4 means lowest and 1 means highest priority. The default value of the parameter = 4.
FTLB hardware FlexiZone Micro hardware unit types:
Packet scheduling queue values range from 1 to 6 where 6 means lowest and 1 means highest priority. The default value of the parameter = 6.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies a packet scheduling queue.
FTIB hardware unit type:
Packet scheduling queue values range from 1 to 4 where 4 means lowest and 1 means highest priority. The default value of the parameter = 4.
FTLB hardware FlexiZone Micro hardware unit types:
Packet scheduling queue values range from 1 to 6 where 6 means lowest and 1 means highest priority. The default value of the parameter = 6.

description.para: This parameter enables the layer 2 switching feature.

If the feature is switched off (false), the Ethernet switching between eNB and backhaul network remains operational, but all other Ethernet ports are inactive. eNBs connected to those ports are effectively disconnected from the transport network.
For FZM hardware variants with integrated WiFi:
BTS Site Manager shall use enableLayer2Switching = TRUE as default setting for manual commissioning. User is allowed to change the value.

shortDesc.para: This parameter enables the layer 2 switching feature.

If the feature is switched off (false), the Ethernet switching between eNB and backhaul network remains operational, but all other Ethernet ports are inactive. eNBs connected to those ports are effectively disconnected from the transport network.
For FZM hardware variants with integrated WiFi:
BTS Site Manager shall use enableLayer2Switching = TRUE as default setting for manual commissioning. User is allowed to change the value.

description.para: For FZM hardware variants with integrated WiFi:
if "actWiFi" of MOC WIFICNF is set to "true", "enableLayer2Switching" must be set to true.
For FZM of type FWHC :
if "administrativeState" of MOC ETHLK pointed by ethLinkPoEPtr of MOC POE is set to "unlocked", "enableLayer2Switching" must be set to true.
By default the feature is switched off. Only a single transport Ethernet interface can be used.
