Default VLAN priority for untagged frames.

Every untagged ingress Ethernet frame at this interface gets assigned this Port Default Priority. If QoS classification mode is configured to VLAN-PCP, this priority is used for enqueing decision of the frame. If the frame egresses the switch tagged, this priority shall be used in the VLAN tag header.

shortDesc.para: Default VLAN priority for untagged frames.

Every untagged ingress Ethernet frame at this interface gets assigned this Port Default Priority. If QoS classification mode is configured to VLAN-PCP, this priority is used for enqueing decision of the frame. If the frame egresses the switch tagged, this priority shall be used in the VLAN tag header.

p.name: portDefaultVlanId
p.fullName: Default VLAN identifier for layer 2 switching

description.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is inserted internally by the FTM into an untagged ingress frame that enters the layer 2 switch via this Ethernet interface - if parameter discardUntagged has value "false" for the Ethernet interface.

To transmit the frame via the same or another Ethernet interface, after layer 2 switching has been performed, the same VLAN Id must be configured in the VLAN identifier list of that Ethernet interface (see parameter l2VlanIdList). Else the frame will be discarded.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is inserted internally by the FTM into an untagged ingress frame that enters the layer 2 switch via this Ethernet interface - if parameter discardUntagged has value "false" for the Ethernet interface.

To transmit the frame via the same or another Ethernet interface, after layer 2 switching has been performed, the same VLAN Id must be configured in the VLAN identifier list of that Ethernet interface. Else the frame will be discarded.

description.para: 15-06-2012, lucy: Description enhanced for PR70298ESPE01
This is the strict priority queue.
This parameter specifies if the layer 2 switching is based on DSCP to PHB mapping or on PCP to PHB mapping.
- In case it is DSCP to PHB mapping, the queue for egress traffic is taken from parameter dscpMap for IP frames and from parameter priorityQueueNonIP for non-IP frames.

- In case it is PCP to PHB mapping, the queue for egress traffic is taken from the parameters priorityQueuePcp0 to priorityQueuePcp7 for tagged frames and from parameter priorityQueueUntagged for untagged frames.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies if the layer 2 switching is based on DSCP to PHB mapping or on PCP to PHB mapping.
- In case it is DSCP to PHB mapping, the queue for egress traffic is taken from parameter dscpMap for IP frames and from parameter priorityQueueNonIP for non-IP frames.

- In case it is PCP to PHB mapping, the queue for egress traffic is taken from the parameters priorityQueuePcp0 to priorityQueuePcp7 for tagged frames and from parameter priorityQueueUntagged for untagged frames.

description.para: Default value means DSCP to PHB mapping.

p.name: vlanAwareSwitch
p.fullName: Flag to decide if VLAN aware switching is used

description.para: This parameter controls the VLAN behavior of the Transport Ethernet switching. It is applicable when the switching feature is enabled.

If set to "true", ethernet frames tagged with a VLAN ID shall be switched between two ethernet member ports of a layer 2 bridge only, if both ports are member of the same VLAN. Else the packet shall be dropped. The handling of untagged frames depends on the parameter acceptableFrameTypes.
If set to "false", any VLAN information is not considered when switching. The switching is purely based on MAC Destination address lookup result.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the QOS based switching mode as follows:

If set to "true", ethernet frames tagged with a VLAN ID shall be switched between two ethernet member ports of a layer 2 bridge only, if both ports are member of the same VLAN. Else the packet shall be dropped. The handling of untagged frames depends on the parameter discardUntagged.
If set to "false", any VLAN information is not considered when switching. The switching is purely based on MAC Destination address lookup result.

additionalInfo.para: Note: this means: if set to "true" and no ethernet port member of the bridge is assigned to any VLAN, all VLAN tagged ethernet frames of the ethernet member ports of that bridge will discarded.

description.para: Default value is not to include VLAN aware switching.

The Local User Acount class (LUAC refers to an account stored in the local database of the BTS. It has a specific user profile. Depending on the authorization profile, a user is either allowed to perform a certain protocol specific operation or not.
LUAC is a singleton. Exactly 1 instances of LUAC is created on startup by the BTS. The instance of LUAC cannot be deleted by the management system.
Singleton.
LUAC contains SETTABLE ONLY parameters for userName and password. For security reason they cannot be read by the management system.
This parameter identifies the local user account configuration of the BTS. It is always 1.

p.fullName: VLAN identifier of the maintenance association

description.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is associated to the Maintenance Association.
The FTM uses this VLAN identifier in the Service OAM messages its sends over the Service OAM ethernet link (configured in the OAMMEP managed object).

Note: The configured VLAN identifier must match the restrictions of the VLAN identifier settings of the Layer 2 bridges of the FTM, in order to prevent that the Service OAM messages are discarded in the bridge.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the VLAN identifier that is associated to the Maintenance Association.
The FTM uses this VLAN identifier in the Service OAM messages its sends over the Service OAM ethernet link (configured in the OAMMEP managed object).The parameter supports FTLB and FTIB HW.

Note: The configured VLAN identifier must match the restrictions of the VLAN identifier settings of the Layer 2 bridges of the FTM, in order to prevent that the Service OAM messages are discarded in the bridge.

pRefDesc.para: Parameter can be used when vlanEnabled is set to true

A Maintenance Domain (MD) is part of a network that is controlled by a single operator and used to support connectivity between the Domain Service Access Points that are bound to the Maintenance Domain. It has a name and a level. Optionally an interface is associated to it.
From BTS point of view, examples for a maintenance domain are:
- the whole transport network (if owned by the operator),
- each leased line or EVC (if the transport network is a Metro Ethernet Network),
- each VLAN (in a multiple VLAN environment),
- an individual link can also be seen as maintenance domain with a low MD level.
At most 10 instances of this managed object class are created and deleted dynamically by the management system.
This parameter identifies a Maintenance Domain. Up to 10 domains may exist on the BTS.

shortDesc.para: This parameter identifies a Maintenance Domain. Up to 10 domains may exist on the BTS.

description.para: A Maintenance Association End Point (MEP) is a service instance that is used to monitor connectivity throughouth a network area, which is the Maintenance Domain.

At most 1 instance per Maintenance Association of this managed object class can be created and deleted dynamically by the management system. This is the local Maintenance Association Endpoint of the association as seen by the management system. A local Maintenance Association Endpoint has associated zero of more remote Maintenance Association Endpoints to it. These are modelled as a parameter (list of end points) of a local Maintenance Association Endpoint.
Deletion of the Maintenance Association End Point shall not be possible, if the MEP has an ongoing Loopback or Link Trace session.

p.name: activateLinkTrace
p.fullName: Action to activate a link trace

description.para: This action starts a Link Trace operation towards a remote Maintenance End Point (MEP). Link trace is a method used for path discovery between MEPs. The same action is used to read back intermediate results of the link trace operation. As long as operationStatus = Ongoing or Completed valid results are returned . BTS allows to start only one linktrace.

shortDesc.para: This action starts a Link Trace operation towards a remote Maintenance End Point (MEP). Link trace is a method used for path discovery between MEPs. The same action is used to read back intermediate results of the link trace operation. As long as operationStatus = Ongoing or Completed valid results are returned. BTS allows to start only one linktrace.

Changing the parameter from false (not allowed) to true (allowed) resets the CCM counters and alarms of all remote MEPs. The parameter support FTLB,FTIB,FSM,FTIF HW.

This parameter specifies the ethernet link that the BTS uses for sending Service OAM messages. The parameter is a local managed object instance identifier (LMOID), i.e. a reference to an instance of object class ETHLK.
Format: "FTM-1/ETHLK-1-*"
where
FTM-#: # = a parent instance of object class ETHLK, This is always 1 (static MO)
ETHLK-#-#.# = an instance of object class ETHLK
Example: FTM-1/ETHLK-1-1
For Flexizone Micro:
In case of FWHC, this parameter shall set values only to FTM-1/ETHLK-1-1 or FTM-1/ETHLK-1-2

where

This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Event. If the number of errored frames detected within the measurement window specified by efEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efEventThreshold equals "32 bit value".

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Event. If the number of errored frames detected within the measurement window specified by efEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efEventThreshold equals "32 bit value".

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666

This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frame Event. If the number of errored frames detected within the measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efEventThreshold, the FTM transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frame Event. If the number of errored frames detected within the measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efEventThreshold, the FTM transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

p.name: efpEventThreshold
p.fullName: Errored Frame Period Event counting threshold

description.para: This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Period Event. If the number of received errored frames within the measurement window specified by efpEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efpEventThreshold equals "32 bit value".

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Period Event. If the number of received errored frames within the measurement window specified by efpEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efpEventThreshold equals "32 bit value".

pRefDesc.para: Configured value for efpEventThreshold should be within configured value for OAMPRF-efpEventWindow to enable the possibility of generating Errored Frame Period Event Notifications

p.name: efpEventWindow
p.fullName: Errored Frame Period Event counting interval

description.para: This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frames. If the number of received errored frames within the measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efpEventThreshold, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frames. If the number of received errored frames within the measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efpEventThreshold, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666

p.name: efssEventThreshold
p.fullName: Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event counting threshold

description.para: This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event. If the number of errored frame seconds that occurred during the specified measurement interval specified by efssEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efssEventThreshold equals "16 bit value".

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the threshold value for counting the Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event. If the number of errored frame seconds that occurred during the specified measurement interval specified by efssEventWindow is exceeded, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.
The maximum value of efssEventThreshold equals "16 bit value".

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666

p.name: efssEventWindow
p.fullName: Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event counting interval

description.para: This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event. If the number of errored frame seconds that occurred during the specified measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efssEventThreshold, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the measurement interval for counting the Errored Frame Seconds Summary Event. If the number of errored frame seconds that occurred during the specified measurement interval exceeds the threshold number specified in parameter efssEventThreshold, the BTS transmits an OAM PDU Event Notification message for that event.

Power over Ethernet
This parameter is used to activate or de-activate power to PoE.

shortDesc.para: This parameter is used to activate or de-activate power to PoE.

description.para: 01.08.2014 Nittala: New parameter added as per LTE1961/CRL3882
This is a reference to the ethernet link interface that the PoE is connected to.
Format: "FTM-1/ETHLK-<slot>-<phy I/F>"
where
FTM-1: = a parent instance of object class ETHLK, This is always 1 (static MO)
ETHLK-<slot>-<phy I/F>: = an instance of object class ETHLK
For HW variants with 3 ports (e.g. FWCB, FWHC, FWHR, FWHT, etc.) the following value is allowed:
FTM-1/ETHLK-1-3: refers to the physical Ethernet interface EIF3 (port C)
For HW variants with 4 ports (e.g. FWQA, etc.) the following value is allowed:
FTM-1/ETHLK-1-4: refers to the physical Ethernet interface EIF4 (port D)
Default value: For HW variants with 3 ports (e.g. FWCB, FWHC, FWHR, FWHT, etc.): "FTM-1/ETHLK-1-3"
For HW variants with 4 ports (e.g. FWQA, etc.): "FTM-1/ETHLK-1-4"

shortDesc.para: This is a reference to the ethernet link interface that the PoE is connected to.
Format: "FTM-1/ETHLK-<slot>-<phy I/F>"
where
FTM-1: = a parent instance of object class ETHLK, This is always 1 (static MO)
ETHLK-<slot>-<phy I/F>: = an instance of object class ETHLK

pRefDesc.para: ETHLK MOC with etherLinkId = "1-3" must exist.Also as part of LTE 1961, ETHLK-1-3 does not support LOAM, SOAM and SyncE.

For HW variants wtih 4 ports (e.g. FWQA, etc.): "FTM-1/ETHLK-1-4"

managedObject.fullName: PDH physical section trail termination point

description.para: This class models a PDH trail termination point. Several instances of this object exist on the BTS depending on the installed hardware unit. All object instances are created on startup by the managed system. They cannot be deleted by the managing system.
This parameter is used to lock and unlock the PDH interface.
Locking the interface deactivates it. All alarms and any user data transfer on the interface is then suppressed.

shortDesc.para: This parameter is used to lock and unlock the PDH interface.
Locking the interface deactivates it. All alarms and any user data transfer on the interface is then suppressed.

pRefDesc.para: When setting the PDH Line Type to another interface type, FTM switches on all interfaces of this unit the PDH Line Type to the default value for that interface type. In the second configuration step the framing format within this interface type can be modified.

description.para: This parameter specifies the frame format of the PDH signal for a physical PDH interface of the unit.
For E1 the possible values are:
- DOUBLEFRAME or
- MULTIFRAME.
For T1 the only possible value is:
- EXTENDED_SUPERFRAME.
For JT1 the only possible value is:
- EXTENDED_MULTIFRAME.

- DOUBLEFRAME or
- MULTIFRAME.
For T1 the only possible value is:

For JT1 the only possible value is:
- EXTENDED_MULTIFRAME.

- PDH_LINE_TYPE_MULTI_FRAME_G704
This parameter identifies the PDH interface.
Format: unit#-if#
where
unit# = slot number of the unit containing the PDH interfaces, and
if# = the interface number of the physical interface on the unit
and
for FTIB/FTLB,
unit#: 1 : This is always 1, since there is only 1 slot.
for FTIF (optional outdoor external Transport module) and FIIF (optional indoor external Transport module),
unit#: 1 : The slot number is '1', since this is an additional unit
if#: 1..8 : Value range is 1..8 for IF1..IF8 on this unit
Note:This is not applicable for FlexiZone Micro hardware.

shortDesc.para: This parameter identifies the PDH interface.
Format: unit#-if#
where
unit# = slot number of the unit containing the PDH interfaces, and
if# = the interface number of the physical interface on the unit
Note:This is not applicable for FlexiZone Micro hardware.

The Quality of Service Configuration class (QOS) holds the Layer 3 Quality of Service Configuration parameters of the BTS.
QOS is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of QOS is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

p.name: dscpMap
p.fullName: Table for mapping DSCPs to PHBs and PCP bits

description.para: This tables maps Diff Servce Code Point (DSCP) values to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) and VLAN priority bit (PCP) values.
The table has as most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value. For non-configured DSCP values, the following defaults are used:
dscp: not configured
pHB: Best Effort
vlanPrio: 0.

shortDesc.para: This tables maps Diff Servce Code Point (DSCP) values to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) and VLAN priority bit (PCP) values.
The table has as most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value. For non-configured DSCP values, the following defaults are used:
dscp: not configured
pHB: Best Effort
vlanPrio: 0.

feature.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

featureComponent.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

description.para: This parameter designates a per hop behaviour wird drop precedence within the PHB class group for Assured Forwarding (AF) or the PHB classes Best Effort (BE) or Expedited Forwarding (EF).

4 PHB classes are defined within the Assured Forwarding group (AF1 to AF4) and three drop precedences within each class. Within each class the drop precedence is as follows: 1 (e.g. AF41) = low drop precedence, 2 (e.g. AF42) = medium drop precedence and 3 ( e.g. AF43) = high drop precedence.

shortDesc.para: This parameter designates a per hop behaviour wird drop precedence within the PHB class group for Assured Forwarding (AF) or the PHB classes Best Effort (BE) or Expedited Forwarding (EF).

4 PHB classes are defined within the Assured Forwarding group (AF1 to AF4) and three drop precedences within each class. Within each class the drop precedence is as follows: 1 (e.g. AF41) = low drop precedence, 2 (e.g. AF42) = medium drop precedence and 3 ( e.g. AF43) = high drop precedence.

p.name: perHopBehaviourWeightList
p.fullName: Per Hop Behaviour queue weight list

description.para: This is a set of 5 weight values for the traffic queues associated to the Per Hop Behaviours:
- Assured Forwarding 4 (AF4)
- Assured Forwarding 3 (AF3)
- Assured Forwarding 2 (AF2)
- Assured Forwarding 1 (AF1)
- Best Effort (BE.
Weight value range is between 1 and 10.000.

shortDesc.para: This is a set of 5 weight values for the traffic queues associated to the Per Hop Behaviours:
- AF4
- AF3
- AF2
- AF1
- BE.
Weight value range is between 1 and 10.000.

additionalInfo.para: The FTM has also a queue for PHB Expedited Traffic (EF). This is however not a weighted but a strict queue.

This parameter specifies if the DSCP value is overwritten in outgoing Site Support Equipment (SSE) messages. The new DSCP value itself is specified in parameter trafficTypesMap.
The default value is false, meaning the original DSCP value is kept.
Note: This parameter is not supported on FlexiZone Micro product.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies if the DSCP value is overwritten in outgoing Site Support Equipment (SSE) messages. The new DSCP value itself is specified in parameter trafficTypesMap.
The default value is false, meaning the original DSCP value is kept.
Note: This parameter is not supported on FlexiZone Micro product.

p.name: trafficTypesMap
p.fullName: Table for mapping traffic types to DSCPs

description.para: This tables maps traffic types to DSCP values.
In this release the table contains entries for
- Control plane traffic
- ICMP traffic
- IPSec IKE traffic
- Management plane traffic
- Synchronization plane traffic
- BFD1 to BFD16
- Site support equipment (SSE).(This is not supported for FlexiZone Micro)
- ICMP Neighbour Solicitation/Advertisement and MLD messages(HighPrioICMPv6). (This is supported only in FSMR3 and FlexiZone Micro HW)
The default mapping is as follows:
TrafficType DSCP (PHB)
CPLANE: 46 (EF)
ICMP: 10 (AF11)
IKE: 34 (AF41)
MPLANE: 34 (AF41)
SPLANE: 46 (EF)
BFD1 to BFD16: 34 (AF41)
SSE: 10 (AF11)
HighPrioICMPv6:56 (EF)

shortDesc.para: This tables maps traffic types to DSCP values. In this release the table contains entries for:
- Control plane traffic
- ICMP traffic
- IPSec IKE traffic
- Management plane traffic
- Synchronization plane traffic
- BFD1 to BFD16
- Site support equipment (SSE).(This is not supported in FlexiZone Micro)
- ICMP Neighbour Solicitation/Advertisement and MLD messages(HighPrioICMPv6).(This is supported only in FSMR3 and FlexiZone Micro HW)
The paramter support FTLB and FTIB HW Values.

additionalInfo.para: The default mapping is as follows:
TrafficType DSCP (PHB)
CPLANE: 46 (EF)
ICMP: 10 (AF11)
IKE: 34 (AF41)
MPLANE: 34 (AF41)
SPLANE: 46 (EF)
BFD1 to BFD16: 34 (AF41)
SSE: 10 (AF11)
HighPrioICMPv6:56 (EF)

This parameter specifies a traffic type.
Allowed values are:
CPLANE: Signalling transport (C-plane) between eNB and MME (S1AP protocol) and signalling transport between eNB nodes (X2AP protocol).
ICMP: ICMP traffic with high and low priority.
IKE: IPSec IKE traffic.
MPLANE: Transport of O&M data between eNB and the OPS System with high and low priority.
SPLANE: Synchronization plane traffic (Timing over Packet)
BFD(BFD1 to BFD16): Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
SSE: Site Support Equipment
HighPrioICMPv6: ICMPv6 traffic with high and low priority.

shortDesc.para: It specifies a traffic type.Allowed values are:
CPLANE:Signalling transport(C-plane)between eNB & MME(S1AP protocol)& signalling transport between eNB nodes(X2AP protocol).
ICMP:ICMP traffic with high&low priority.
IKE:IPSecIKE traffic.
MPLANE:Transport of O&M data between eNB & the OPS System with high&low priority.
SPLANE:Synchronization plane traffic(TOP)
BFD(BFD1 to BFD16):Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
SSE:Site Support Equipment
HighPrioICMPv6:ICMPv6 traffic with high&low priority

Routing policy.
This is a list of routing policies. Each entry in the list consists of several parameters.

shortDesc.para: This is a list of routing policies. Each entry in the list consists of several parameters.

description.para: This parameter stores the priority associated with the policy. The smallest orderNumber has the highest priority.

shortDesc.para: This parameter stores the priority associated with the policy. The smallest orderNumber has the highest priority.

description.para: A reference to a routing table. This is a distinguished name referencing an instance of class IPRT or IPRTV6.
Format: "FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRT-1" or "FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRTV6-1"
where
FTM-1: = a parent instance of object class IPNO, This is always 1 (static MO)
IPNO-1: = a parent instance of object class IPRT,
IPRT-#: # = an instance of object class IPRT
IPRTV6-#: # = an instance of object class IPRTV6
A policy may refer also to the main routing table.
Example: FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRT-1
Note: FSMr2 supports only IPRT-1.

shortDesc.para: A reference to a routing table. This is a distinguished name referencing an instance of class IPRT or IPRTV6.
Format: "FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRT-1" or "FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRTV6-1"
where
FTM-1: = a parent instance of object class IPNO, This is always 1 (static MO)
IPNO-1: = a parent instance of object class IPRT,
IPRT-#: # = an instance of object class IPRT
IPRTV6-#: # = an instance of object class IPRTV6
A policy may refer also to the main routing table.
Example: FTM-1/IPNO-1/IPRT-1

description.para: 270911, Vipul : Added new parameters

The Synchronization Protection Group class provides a protection mechanism for the BTS clock synchronisation in case a clock synchronization source is defected. STPG allows the BTS to fall back to a secondary synchronization source or to the internal clock in case of clock source defects.
STPG is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of STPG is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
Singleton. This object is created at startup by the managed system. It cannot be deleted by the management system.

p.name: synchroSourceList
p.fullName: The synchronization sources of the BTS

description.para: This is the list of synchronization sources of the BTS. Up to 2 clock sources can be configured.

shortDesc.para: This is the list of synchronization sources of the BTS. Up to 2 clock sources can be configured.

description.para: This parameter holds the protocol of this clock source: PDH, synchronuous Ethernet, or Time over Packet.
In this release only the Time Over Packet clock is supported.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the protocol of this clock source: PDH, synchronuous Ethernet, or Time over Packet.
In this release only the Time Over Packet clock is supported.

description.para: 14-06-2012, lucy: Remove enum value "5:extClk" due to PR93179ESPE04
This parameter specifies either
- the physical location of the PDH interface location on the unit for a PDH synchronization source, or
- the physical location of the ethernet interface of the unit for the synchronous Ethernet synchronization source.
In case of Timing over Packet the BTS automatically selects the Ethernet link. This parameter is ignored.
Examples:
interfaceNumber=1, unitNumber=1, clockProtocol=clkPDH: This means PDH interface number 1 on unit 1.
interfaceNumber=1, unitNumber=1, clockProtocol=clkSyncE: This means Ethernet interface number 1 on unit 1.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies either
- the physical location of the PDH interface location on the unit for a PDH synchronization source,
- the physical location of the ethernet interface of the unit for the synchronous Ethernet synchronization source.
In case of Timing over Packet the BTS automatically selects the Ethernet link. This parameter is ignored.

pRefDesc.para: For physical interfaces, the interfaceNumber also depends on the clock protocol selected.
For physical interfaces, the interfaceNumber depends on the referenced unitNumber.

description.para: For physical interfaces, the interfaceNumber should be considered in conjunction with the unitNumber and the clockProtocol, since the available interfaces depend on the referenced unit, and the selected clock protocol.

property.name: PAR HW_Values
property.value: FTIB, FTLB:[1-4]; FSM:[1-2]; FSI:[1-5]; FTIF,FIIF:[1-8]

description.para: This is the operational state of the recovered clock object.

shortDesc.para: This is the operational state of the recovered clock object.

description.para: This parameter holds the priority in which the Transport clock sources are to be taken into use. Value 1 ist highest priority: this clock source will be taken first.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the priority in which the Transport clock sources are to be taken into use. Value 1 ist highest priority: this clock source will be taken first.

description.para: This parameter enables SSM support (Synchronization Status Message) for Synchronuous Ethernet.

shortDesc.para: This parameter enables SSM support (Synchronization Status Message) for Synchronuous Ethernet.

pRefDesc.para: The parameter ssmEnabled is only relevant in case the value of parameter clockProtocol is equal to clkSyncE (Synchronuous Ethernet clock source).

description.para: By default SSM support is enabled.
This is the maximum duration in seconds for which the actual SSM value may be less than ssmPRC or SSU_A or SSU_B clock quality. If the duration is surpassed, an alarm will be raised.

shortDesc.para: This is the maximum duration in seconds for which the actual SSM value may be less than ssmPRC or SSU_A or SSU_B clock quality. If the duration is surpassed, an alarm will be raised.

description.para: The parameter ssmEnabled is only relevant in case the value of parameter clockProtocol is equal to clkSyncE (Synchronuous Ethernet clock source).In case of other sources, after CM Upload to NetAct, the value is always set to default.
This is the defined SSM value (observed quality of the source clock). If this falls below the value defined in ssmAcceptanceLevel quality for ssmTimeout seconds, an alarm will be raised.

shortDesc.para: This is the defined SSM value (observed quality of the source clock). If this falls below the value defined in ssmAcceptanceLevel quality for ssmTimeout seconds, an alarm will be raised.

pRefDesc.para: An alarm is raised if the observed quality of clock source in ssmValue is below the value defined in ssmAcceptanceLevel for a period of ssmTimeout seconds.

description.para: [12-02-2013, Pratima]: This is the new parameter added that was removed by mistake previously.
This parameter specifies the location of the unit providing the synchronisation source interface.

NOTE:unitNumber parameter is ignored when clockProtocol parameter has value clkTop. In case of clkTop, unitNumber parameter is optional. For syncE sources FTIF & FIIF units will support both values 0 and 1, for FSM and FSI unitNumber can be 0 and for all other units types, unit number is 1. The unit number of PDH synchronization source must be 1. This validation rule is valid for all unit types which support PDH interfaces and when clockProtocol parameter has value clkPDH. PDH synchronization source is not supported in FTOA, FSM, and FSI.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the location of the unit providing the synchronisation source interface.

additionalInfo.para: unitNumber parameter is ignored when clockProtocol parameter has value clkTop. In case of clkTop, unitNumber parameter is optional. For syncE sources FTIF & FIIF units will support both values 0 and 1, for FSM and FSI unitNumber can be 0 and for all other units types, unit number is 1. The unit number of PDH synchronization source must be 1. This validation rule is valid for all unit types which support PDH interfaces and when clockProtocol parameter has value clkPDH. PDH synchronization source is not supported in FTOA, FSM, and FSI.

The Clock Synchronization class (SYNC) represents the synchronization functionality of the BTS. It refers to the currently active clock synchronization source of the BTS. It also configures the internal clock.
SYNC is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of SYNC is created at system startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

This parameter is used to decide if the selection of the active master shall be done according the IEEE1588-2008 or according to the ITU-T telecom profile (G.8265.1 (10/2010)).
Furthermore with this parameter the clock quality level is distinguished.

shortDesc.para: This parameter is used to decide if the selection of the active master shall be done according the IEEE1588-2008 or according to the ITU-T telecom profile (G.8265.1 (10/2010)).
Furthermore with this parameter the clock quality level is distinguished.

description.para: This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period. (The transmission duration request period is currently fixed to 300 seconds.)
The following values are defined:
-3: 8 per second
-4: 16 per second
-5: 32 per second

shortDesc.para: This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period (of 300 seconds).

description.para: This means 16 per second.
This parameter selects the PTP domain number, that is inserted in the header of the PTP message.
TOPIK-telecomProfile The range and the default value shall depend on the selected profile (WBTS_SYNC_70214)

shortDesc.para: This parameter selects the PTP domain number, that is inserted in the header of the PTP message.

description.para: The range and the default value shall depend on the selected profile, The specified default value is for default telecom profile IEEE1588 and should be changed accordingly when telecom profile changes, the values to be changed are below.
IEEE 1588 : 0
ITU-telecom: 4

p.name: topMasters
p.fullName: Timing over Packet masters properties table

description.para: This parameter specifies a table that holds all properties of the configured Timing over Packet masters of the BTS.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies a table that holds all properties of the configured Timing over Packet masters of the BTS.

description.para: This parameter shows if the ToP master is currently used as synchronization source. The value "locked" means the ToP master is currently used synchronization source. Please note that only one master can be in "locked" state at a time. This parameter shows if the ToP slave in the BTS is locked to this master. The value "locked" means that accurate reference clock is available and can be used as the timing source for the BTS. At most one master can be in “locked” state at a time.

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows if the ToP master is currently used as synchronization source. The value "locked" means the ToP master is currently used synchronization source. Please note that only one master can be in "locked" state at a time. This parameter shows if the ToP slave in the BTS is locked to this master. The value "locked" means that accurate reference clock is available and can be used as the timing source for the BTS. At most one master can be in “locked” state at a time.

description.para: This parameter shows if Timing over Packet master is working or not. The value "NOT_OK" means this master is not in a condition to be considered as synchronization source. “topMasterState” will be set to OK if the ToP Master is sending Announce Message replies to FTM and the delivered clock quality is acceptable.

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows if Timing over Packet master is working or not. The value "NOT_OK" means this master is not in a condition to be considered as synchronization source. “topMasterState” will be set to OK if the ToP Master is sending Announce Message replies to FTM and the delivered clock quality is acceptable.

p.name: masterIpAddr
p.fullName: IP Address of the ToP master

description.para: This parameter specifies the IP address of the ToP master. To be entered in dotted format.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the IP address of the ToP master. To be entered in dotted format.

pRefDesc.para: masterIpAddr must be configured if actTopFreqSynch = TRUE

description.para: This parameter indicates that the announce messages are received from master x.
This parameter is applicable ONLY for the ToP variant with Frequency sync.

shortDesc.para: This parameter indicates that the announce messages are received from master x.
This parameter is applicable ONLY for the ToP variant with Frequency sync.

property.name: PAR LTE_HW
property.value: FTLB, FTIB

description.para: 05.06.2014 Nittala: Added new parameter as per PR 50376ESPE05

This parameter specifies the configured priority 1 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
range is 1..255 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the configured priority 1 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
range is 1..255 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

additionalInfo.para: Changing between the modes requires restart of the ToP resilience functionality

description.para: The default value depends on announce message mode of TOP Master, the specified default value is for default announceRequestMode standard

def 0 if Announce messages are requested from all masters (Standard)For ITU Profile , default should be 128 and range should be '1..255'. def 128 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master(NSN)

special.text: Do not use the parameter, use received priority 1.

description.para: This parameter specifies the configured priority 2 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
value is fixed at 128 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the configured priority 2 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
value is fixed at 128 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

additionalInfo.para: Changing between the modes requires restart of the ToP resilience functionality

description.para: The default value depends on requested message mode of TOP Master, default value specified here is for default request message mode standard and should be changed when the request message mode changes as specified below
def is 0 if Announce messages are requested from all masters.
For ITU Profile , default should be 128 and range should be '1..255'. def 128 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

special.text: Do not use the parameter, use received priority 2.

p.name: receivedClockQuality
p.fullName: Received clock quality level from master

description.para: Received clock quality level from master

shortDesc.para: Received clock quality level from master

description.para: This parameter holds the priority 1 as received from this Timing over Packet master. In case the configured priority 1 value equals 0, the received priority 1 is used for selecting the ToP master that shall be selected to provide the Timing over Packet clock signal.
Lower values mean higher preference.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the priority 1 as received from this Timing over Packet master. In case the configured priority 1 value equals 0, the received priority 1 is used for selecting the ToP master that shall be selected to provide the Timing over Packet clock signal.
Lower values mean higher preference.

description.para: This parameter holds the priority 2 as received from this Timing over Packet master. In case the configured priority 2 value equals 0, the received priority 2 is used for selecting the ToP master that shall be selected to provide the Timing over Packet clock signal.
Lower values mean higher preference.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the priority 2 as received from this Timing over Packet master. In case the configured priority 2 value equals 0, the received priority 2 is used for selecting the ToP master that shall be selected to provide the Timing over Packet clock signal.
Lower values mean higher preference.

description.para: This parameter shows if this Timing over Packet master can be selected as the provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal. This parameter shows if this master has been selected by ToP best master clock algorithm (BMCA) as the provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows if this Timing over Packet master can be selected as the provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal. This parameter shows if this master has been selected by ToP best master clock algorithm (BMCA) as the provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.

description.para: This parameter defines the time in seconds, the ToP slave has to wait, before switching the active ToP master

shortDesc.para: This parameter defines the time in seconds, the ToP slave has to wait, before switching the active ToP master

description.para: This object class holds the information for all parameters relevant for phase sync ToP.
This parameter represents the accepted clock quality class.

shortDesc.para: This parameter represents the accepted clock quality class.

additionalInfo.para: "The allowed values represent the IEEE 1588, ITU-T G.8275.1 defined clock classes applicable to clocks related to phase/time synchronization and which a boundary clock might use in case it loses traceability to the original Grandmaster clock.
Note: User needs to be aware that a ToP master operating at arbitrary time scale (CC 13, 14, 58, 193), will offset its ToD related to the used timescale as calculations are based on PTP timescale."

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

featureComponent.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
19-09-2013 Pratima: Default value 135 has been removed and the modified default note has been added.
18.06.2015 Nittala: Modified default value notes to include 135 as per PR053407.

Default value depends on selected communication mode. The specified default value is for the UP Unicast communication mode profile and should be changed when the communication mode changes as from below values, IP Unicast communication mode: 6, 7
Ethernet Multicast communication mode: 6, 7 and 135.

p.name: actTopPhaseSynch
p.fullName: Feature Activation Flag ToP with phase synchronization

description.para: This parameter activates/deactivates the feature "ToP with phase synchronization".
The feature is not supported with FSMr2 HW.

shortDesc.para: This parameter activates/deactivates the feature "ToP with phase synchronization".
The feature is not supported with FSMr2 HW.

additionalInfo.para: When activating ToP with phase synchronization, then the BTS Sync Mode has to be set to phase synchronization.
As setting of BTS Sync Mode requires a restart activating ToP with phase synchronization is recommended to be done with commissioning procedure.
The feature 'ToP with phase synchronization' is not supported with FSMr2 HW.

pRefDesc.para: one of the 2 entries parameter "clockProtocol" is set to "clkTop" and actToPPhase Sync = true then actToPFreqSynch = false.
If actToPPhaseSynch is 'true', then sPlaneIpAddress must be configured.

p.fullName: Grandmaster clock traceable to a PRC clock

description.para: This parameter denotes whether the current grandmaster clock in the timing network is traceable to a PRC clock.

additionalInfo.para: The parameter provides additional information whether a grandmaster clock which is at holdover is at holdover at its own local oscillator or uses a PRC traceable frequency source for supporting its holdover mode.

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

featureComponent.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period (of 300 seconds).

shortDesc.para: This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period (of 300 seconds).

additionalInfo.para: "This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the unicast duration request period. (The unicast duration request period is currently fixed to 300 seconds.)
The following values are defined:
-6: 64 per second
-7: 128 per second "

pRefDesc.para: Only applicable if topComMode = IP Unicast (0)

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

featureComponent.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
-7 means 128 msgs per second
The phase of the output phase of ToP phase synchronization will be adjusted by the value in terms of nanonseconds of this parameter.

shortDesc.para: The phase of the output phase of ToP phase synchronization will be adjusted by the value in terms of nanonseconds of this parameter.

additionalInfo.para: The parameter allows compensation of systematic asymmetric delays at the timing network.

Phase error to be compensated < 0: The recovered phase comes later than the transition of the reference phase. In this case the output phase will be advanced by a time interval equal to the configured value.

Phase error to be compensated > 0: The recovered phase comes earlier than the transition of the reference phase. In this case, the output phase will be delayed by the time interval equal to the configured value.
Note: Parameter should be set/changed at timepoint of commissioning. On-line change is supported too, but network element needs time to adapt and phase might temporary fluctuate.

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

featureComponent.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
19-09-2013 Pratima: Additional Info has been modified.
This parameter configures the communication mode for Timing over Packet to be either IP Unicast or Ethernet Multicast.

shortDesc.para: This parameter configures the communication mode for Timing over Packet to be either IP Unicast or Ethernet Multicast.

additionalInfo.para: "IP Unicast is applicable for partial on-path timing network topologies.
Ethernet Multicast is applicable for full on-path timing network topologies,
relating to the full on-path profile as defined at ITU-T G.8275.1. Ethernet Multicast uses the ITU-T G.8275.1 defined Multicast address for ToP."

p.name: masterClockState
p.fullName: Timing over Packet master clock state

description.para: This parameter shows the state of the Timing over Packet master clock.

shortDesc.para: This parameter shows the state of the Timing over Packet master clock.

additionalInfo.para: "Master Clock OK denotes that there is a operational connection to the ToP master clock. Further that the class and priority of the master clock is lower compared to the BTS integrated slave clock and the clock class is accepted.
Master Clock DISABLED denotes that there is no operational connection to the ToP master clock.

Master Clock NOK denotes that there is an operational connection to the ToP master clock, but the class and priority of the master clock is higher compared to the BTS integrated slave clock or the clock class is not accepted."

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
This object class allows supervision of an IP path according to RFC 5357. There can be max 10 instances of TWAMP objects. Instances are created and deleted by the management system.

p.name: administrativeState
p.fullName: Lock or unlock a TWAMP session

description.para: This parameter locks or unlocks the TWAMP session. Locking a session stops it. Unlocking a session starts or re-starts it.
Starting or re-starting a session clears all statistics and alarms for the session. Stopping a session clears TWAMP alarms but not TWAMP statistics.

shortDesc.para: This parameter locks or unlocks the TWAMP session. Locking a session stops it. Unlocking a session starts or re-starts it.
Starting or re-starting a session clears all statistics and alarms for the session. Stopping a session clears TWAMP alarms but not TWAMP statistics.

This parameter specifies the destination IP address of the TWAMP session. The TWAMP session must be locked, before its destination IP address can be changed.
Both IP address formats can be used.
Format: IPv4 address parameter in dotted decimals or IPv6 address parameter acc. to RFC 4291.

25-04-2013pratima: unit has been defined as ms.
This parameter specifies the size of the TWAMP messages sent by the TWAMP initiator on this session.

The value of the parameter shall not exceed the Maximum Transfer Unit value of the BTS and the configured TWAMP message source address must be identical with one of the configured eNB application or interface IP addresses (if different addresses are used, one might need additional routing entries).

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the size of the TWAMP messages sent by the TWAMP initiator on this session.

The value of the parameter shall not exceed the Maximum Transfer Unit value of the BTS and the configured TWAMP message source address must be identical with one of the configured eNB application or interface IP addresses (if different addresses are used, one might need additional routing entries).

pRefDesc.para: The value of the parameter messageSize shall not exceed the Maximum Transfer Unit value.

description.para: 14122010,vipul : added new SEM param for LTE574
25-04-2013pratima: unit has been defined as ms.
This parameter specifies the threshold for raising the TWAMP session alarm for reasons of excessive packet loss ratio (PRL).

The alarm is raised, if the packet loss ratio observed over a 15 minute evalutation period exceeds the threshold value. The alarm will be cleared if the packet loss ratio drops below the threshold value for 2 consecutive 15-minute observation periods.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the threshold for raising the TWAMP session alarm for reasons of excessive packet loss ratio (PRL).

The alarm is raised, if the packet loss ratio observed over a 15 minute evalutation period exceeds the threshold value. The alarm will be cleared if the packet loss ratio drops below the threshold value for 2 consecutive 15-minute observation periods.

description.para: 08-06-2012, lucy: Corrected description for CN4979 / CRL0666
03112010, vipul : copied the new parameter from WCDMA for LTE574
Default value is 100 percent. This means the alarm is only raised if packet loss = 100%.
This parameter specifies the threshold for raising the TWAMP session alarm for reasons of excessive round-trip-time (RTT).

The alarm is raised if the average round-trip-time of the TWAMP messages, calculated during a 1-minute evaluation period, exceeds the configured threshold. The alarm will be cleared, if during 5 consecutive 1-minute periods the average value of the RTT remains below the threshold.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the threshold for raising the TWAMP session alarm for reasons of excessive round-trip-time (RTT).

The alarm is raised if the average round-trip-time of the TWAMP messages, calculated during a 1-minute evaluation period, exceeds the configured threshold. The alarm will be cleared, if during 5 consecutive 1-minute periods the average value of the RTT remains below the threshold.

description.para: 03112010, vipul : copied the new parameter from WCDMA for LTE574
22-05-2013 Pratima: HW value info has been removed from the Description.
Default value is 1 second.

p.name: sourceIpAddress
p.fullName: TWAMP initiator messages source IP address

description.para: This parameter specifies the source IP address of TWAMP initiator messages. The TWAMP session must be locked, before its source IP address can be changed.
Both IP address formats can be used.
Format: IPv4 address parameter in dotted decimals or IPv6 address parameter acc. to RFC 4291.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the source IP address of TWAMP initiator messages. The TWAMP session must be locked, before its source IP address can be changed.

pRefDesc.para: The TWAMP session must be locked, before its source IP address can be changed (set administrativeState to "locked").

description.para: This parameter holds the total number of transmitted TWAMP messages since the start or re-start of the TWAMP session.
This is a 32 bit value.

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the total number of transmitted TWAMP messages since the start or re-start of the TWAMP session.

description.para: 15122010,vipul : added new SEM parameter for LTE574

The Hardware Unit class (UNIT) holds parameters that define the properties of the Flexi Transport Module hardware.

UNIT is a singleton. The Flexi Transport Module contains only 1 unit hardware slot. Exactly 1 instance of UNIT is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
Configure and designate EIF2(Outdoor)/EIF5(Indoor) in the BTS as an RP3-01 interface.
NOTE: This parameter should be "false" by default for FSM and FSI. This parameter should be "true" by default for FSIH.
By default the shared RP3-01/EIF port shall be used as Transport interface for FSM and FSI.The default is RF for FSIH.
Note: This is not relevant for FlexiZone Micro product.

shortDesc.para: Configure and designate EIF2(Outdoor)/EIF5(Indoor) in the BTS as an RP3-01 interface.
NOTE: This parameter should be "false" by default for FSM and FSI. This parameter should be "true" by default for FSIH.
By default the shared RP3-01/EIF port shall be used as Transport interface for FSM and FSI.The default is RF for FSIH.
Note: This is not relevant for FlexiZone Micro product.

pRefDesc.para: This parameter is applicable only when unitTypeExpected is one of FSM, or FSI.

This parameter holds the product code of the hardware unit.
Format of productCode is SSSSSSS.VCC where
SSSSSSS = product code
V = version of the unit
CC = modification of the unit
V is 0..9 for customer releases but may be character (e.g. "X") for prototypes
CC is always 00..99

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the product code of the hardware unit.
Format of productCode is SSSSSSS.VCC where
SSSSSSS = product code
V = version of the unit
CC = modification of the unit
V is 0..9 for customer releases but may be character (e.g. "X") for prototypes
CC is always 00..99

description.para: This parameter holds the serial number of the hardware unit.

description.para: This parameter holds the slot number of the hardware unit of BTS transport. The value is always 1 (only 1 slot is available).

description.para: Integrated WiFi Configuration
Enable or disable WiFi. Only applicable to hardware variants with integrated WiFi.

shortDesc.para: Enable or disable WiFi. Only applicable to hardware variants with integrated WiFi.

description.para: actWiFi can be set to TRUE only if enableLayer2Switching is set to TRUE.
This is an action parameter to trigger WiFi Access Point to reboot and come up with factory setting.

shortDesc.para: This is an action parameter to trigger WiFi Access Point to reboot and come up with factory setting.

additionalInfo.para: When both factoryResetWiFi and rebootWiFi are set, reset WiFi to factory setting will take place.

description.para: factoryResetWiFi can be set only if actWiFi is set to TRUE.
This is an action parameter to trigger reboot of WiFi.

shortDesc.para: This is an action parameter to trigger reboot of WiFi.

additionalInfo.para: When both factoryResetWiFi and rebootWiFi are set, reset WiFi to factory setting will take place.

description.para: rebootWiFi can be set only if actWiFi is set to TRUE.
This parameter limits the amount of uplink traffic in Mbps originated from WiFi Access Point, in order to prevent starvation of the shared backhaul due to large amount of WiFi traffic.
The default value is 300 Mbps.
Note: This parameter is not applicable for indoor HW variants with integrated WiFi.

shortDesc.para: This parameter limits the amount of uplink traffic in Mbps originated from WiFi Access Point, in order to prevent starvation of the shared backhaul due to large amount of WiFi traffic.
The default value is 300Mbps.
Note: This parameter is not applicable for indoor HW variants with integrated WiFi.
